review: It's a decent survivor horror adventure game. The achievements are mostly respectful of your time. Good atmosphere, holds up well 10 years later.

author: {'steamid': '76561198969130921', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1698862681}
review:
Une aventure de type "escape game" dans un manoir √©trange. L'ambiance est pesante d√®s le d√©part et on se sent observ√©, mais on ne sait pas par quoi. On doit explorer le manoir, ou du moins les pi√®ces auxquelles on a acc√®s. Pour acc√©der √† une nouvelle pi√®ce, on doit trouver sa maquette et la relier √† la maquette de l'entr√©e. Un gameplay original dans une ambiance myst√©rieuse et stressante, qui devient vite effrayante car on n'est pas seulement observ√©, on est pourchass√© et on doit survivre √† des attaques. Cette atmosph√®re est bien servie par les d√©cors graphiques et sonores qui sont tr√®s bien faits. Certains passages sont tr√®s oppressants et l'histoire se d√©voile au fur et √† mesure de l'exploration du manoir.

Court mais gratuit, c'est une exp√©rience qui vaut vraiment le coup malgr√© quelques bugs emb√™tants :
- ma sauvegarde a bug et j'ai d√ª tout recommenc√© (mais le jeu est court)
- j'ai √©t√© d√©connect√©e plusieurs fois du jeu
- je me suis aussi retrouv√©e bloqu√©e dans un passage non pr√©vu, manifestement
Les commandes sont assez classiques donc plut√¥t intuitives, sauf les interactions avec les objets qui ne fonctionnent pas toujours tr√®s bien et qui ne sont pas claires malgr√© les explications et une traduction fran√ßaise soign√©e.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994686382', 'num_games_owned': 1219, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1697890861}
review:
Kraven Manor.

the indie game with motion sickness and dizziness caused by the head bobbing effect, yuck.

i tryed.... i truly tryed to enjoy this game, it has its own little scary moments, have its own little story, warped in walking simulator gameplay and nice puzzles, but its just inpossible to enjoy anything when you are on the edge of vomiting on your monitor because of the head bobbing, which you cant even turn off.

the second major problem are the excessive resource usage of the game, like common dude, this game runs on unity or some old unreal engine, there is no reason to throttle up the GPU up to 80 celsius, no idea wtf is going in this part of the game.

i really wanted to give a positive review of this game because its in the "okay" category among the indie games gameplay quality, maybe i could turn a blind eye on the high resource usage as well, the game only last for 1 hour... maybe 2 if you replay on nightmare for the achievements.

but then we still have that motion sickness problem, which i cant ignore, thats a big no no for me in any game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996859750', 'num_games_owned': 821, 'num_reviews': 396, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1690145525}
review: Pretty good, short first person horror adventure! It has an interesting mechanic where you have to arrange the rooms of this manor, and that creates some really cool opportunities for puzzles. The creatures also have an interesting behavior where they chase you only when you are not watching them, so that also create some real fun and tense moments. The story is really twisted, and it's great to uncover and piece it together little by little. Really enjoyable for a free student project!

author: {'steamid': '76561198092034210', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 137, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1689896161}

The game is about 40 minutes long and is basically one big (yet relatively small) puzzle. If you've watched the trailer, you know that a mannequin follows you, much like that SCP. It's not scary, but the tension builds up. Until you're really ''tense''.

But I assume this is a school project seeing the awards and as a free game I can recommend it. But I would have not paid for it, it was so short. Had amnesia vibes to it and considering it came out 2014, I am not surprised by the fact. ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198125735973', 'num_games_owned': 46, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 344, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 344, 'last_played': 1679746388}
review: Bon. S'agissant d'un projet √©tudiant totalement gratuit utilisant l'UDK d'il y a 10 ans, je ne vais pas cracher dans la soupe les probl√®mes de collision lorsqu'on porte un objet √† la Amnesia, ni du syst√®me de sprint compl√®tement foir√©.Le jeu durera d'une demie-heure √† une heure pour les plus patients d'entre vous √† vouloir refaire le jeu pour trouver un moyen de d√©bloquer la bonne fin (car oui il existe une bonne fin, et c'est en rapport avec la 1√®re porte du rez-de chauss√©e c√¥t√© Est sans trop spoiler). L'exp√©rience du jeu √©tait frustrante pour une seule et bonne raison : les sauvegardes automatiques.Alors attention, j'ai rien contre elles de base, c'est m√™me plut√¥t pratique pour des jeux script√©s comme Kraven Manor. Le probl√®me r√©side dans le fait qu'il n'ait qu'une seule save et qu'elles puissent √™tre corrompues √† force d'√™tre recharg√©es (√ßa √©t√© mon cas car compl√©tiste de succ√®s Steam que je suis, je voulais faire le succ√®s Escapist).Hormis √ßa, le jeu pour son √©poque, et encore m√™me en 2023, est assez beau. Le m√©lange horreur, √©nigmes et action est tr√®s bien √©quilibr√© dans ce jeu qui ne vous prendra pas plus d'une heure pour en voir le bout. Les monstres reprennent la m√™me m√©canique que la statue dans SCP : CB (d'ailleurs une musique √† un moment est une reprise d'un des SCP). La bande sonore est sympathique quoique absente √† certains moments du jeu. Le gameplay est moyennement r√©ussi (syst√®me d‚Äôinteraction personnage/environnement perfectible, temps d'affichage de description des objets trop rapide, syst√®me de sprint peu fiable).Enfin l'histoire nous transporte dans un pitch classique de manoir hant√© avec un docteur fou enfermant des √¢mes... Dans des pantins. √áa reste pr√©visible et cousu de fil blanc, quoique le retournement de situation de la mauvaise fin est plut√¥t bien fichu. En conclusion, Kraven Manor, pour un jeu gratuit datant de 2014 offre une bonne apr√®s-midi √† vous emporter dans une aventure sympathique au sein d'un manoir sans quasiment aucun temps de chargement. Ce qui est un exploit vu qu'on peut mod√©liser √† sa guise les pi√®ces qu'on souhaite connecter et les tourner √† son avantage pour r√©soudre des puzzles. Je recommande.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996720254', 'num_games_owned': 2069, 'num_reviews': 174, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1671826228}
review:
[h1]What manner of such a craven mind have we entered?[/h1]

[b][u]PROS[/u]:[/b] Kraven Manor is a short indie horror game that follows the traditional Steam first person horror standards, taking on the philosophy of less is more.  The only controls one has is to run & use the flashlight.  Though sparse, bronze mannequins will pop up from time to time to chase the player.  The shiftable rooms that lead progression can be placed in almost any order around the main hall, & the game takes advantage of this, using it to solve what few puzzles the game has.  The story can be pieced together through notes scattered about, & the protagonist's thoughts are jotted down in their journal.  The atmosphere is ominous, the soundtrack adding to said atmosphere.  Most importantly, the title is free, giving its short length an easy pass.

[b][u]CONS[/u]:[/b] Sadly, it falls into all the issues that cheaper Steam horror games fall into: the lack of replayablitiy, the short length, & the basic frustrations of only being able to run from enemies that can teleport around from time to time.  These are actually the only real faults the game has, unfortunately placing it in a bit of a design-by-numbers standpoint in terms of pacing, though using enough at its disposal to stand out, even in just a small way.

[b][u]ACHIEVEMENTS[/u]:[/b] A very brief list tied into how quick the game is.  All one has to do is solve all the puzzles, & the bulk of the list is done.  Nightmare mode only makes enemies slightly faster & makes it so the flashlight must be recharged from time to time.  Clearing without taking damage is actually simple, as one can simply leave to the main menu to reset the hit & try again.

[b][u]FINAL[/u]:[/b] Kraven Manor is a simple horror game that doesn't really try to reach for anything truly unique.  However, its simple premise, short length, & free price tag makes the title an easy recommend.  It's very similar to a haunted house ride.  Give it a try at the only cost being your time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045261968', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1665189174}
review:
Overall the game is fantastic! I loved the atmosphere and the soundtrack. The ability to move rooms around is novel and fun. The puzzles are simple enough to keep the game moving without headache.

A couple minor critiques: 
1. the lightning/thunder every 5 seconds is distracting and annoying in the main hall. 
2. The statue man isnt particularly scary after the first couple jumps

Otherwise besides a few bug issues a great little horror game that's even better because it's free :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198042620952', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1382, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1655601414}
review:
[h1] Genre [/h1] Ein First Person Indie Horror

[h1] Story [/h1] Eine direkte Story gibt es nicht. Wir betreten ein Anwesen namens "Kraven Manor" und bemerken schon kurz nach unserer Ankunft das etwas nicht stimmt

[h1] Gameplay [/h1] Das Spiel ist relativ kurz und man kann es in 30-45 Minuten durchspielen. Wir laufen in der First Person Ansicht durch vorerst nur der Eingangshalle und betreten nach und nach verschiedene R√§ume. Zu Anfang sind die R√§ume bis auf einem verschlossen. In jedem Raum finden wir meist ein Modell St√ºck eines Raums z.B. Schlafzimmer usw. Diese setzen wir dann in der Eingangshalle auf dem Tisch ein. Tun wir dies, √∂ffnet sich ein Puzzle, wo wir die einzelnen Teile an der Eingangshalle anbauen k√∂nnen und je nachdem wo wir es hinzugef√ºgt haben, √∂ffnet sich die T√ºr auf der Seite. Ich fand das Feature echt cool gemacht, habe ich so noch nicht gesehen auch wenn es jetzt am Gameplay nichts ver√§ndert ist es doch mal was neues. Die R√§ume an sich bleiben immer gleich, es gibt nichts Random. Es gibt viele gescriptete Events wo wir des √∂fteren vor etwas davon rennen m√ºssen. Abwehren k√∂nnen wir den Feind wenn wir ihn anschauen, dann bewegt er sich nicht, man kennt es ja aus anderen Indie Horror Spielen. Atmosph√§re fand ich auch gut gelungen, das Ende bzw. die Endings dagegen habe ich √ºberhaupt nicht verstanden

[h1] Achievements [/h1] Es gibt insgesamt 11 Erfolge. Hierf√ºr muss man das Spiel sowohl im Normalen als auch im Alptraum Modus beenden, das Spiel durchspielen ohne Schaden zu nehmen (man kann jedesmal einen Checkpoint laden falls man schaden nimmt) und ein paar bestimmte Gegenst√§nde finden um dadurch dann das Zweite Ending sehen zu k√∂nnen

[h1] Pro/Contra [/h1]
+ Kostenlos
+ Gute Atmosph√§re
+ Coole Idee mit dem Modell Puzzle in der Eingangshalle
+ Faire Checkpoints
+ Achievements

- Story wird nicht richtig erkl√§rt (man wird einfach rein geworfen ins Spiel)
- Endings habe ich eben dadurch nicht verstanden
- 2 mal hatte ich einen CTD nachdem ich Checkpoints des √∂fteren geladen habe

[h1] Fazit [/h1] Ein an sich recht Gutes Indie Horror Spiel mit coolen eigenen Ideen (das Modell Puzzle) aber auch eben einigen Schw√§chen wie z.B. die mangelnde Story Erkl√§rung und die dazu verwirrenden Endings. Es ist wieder so ein Spiel wof√ºr man hier eigentlich einen Mittleren Daumen braucht. Mich hat das Spiel aber doch gut Unterhalten in der kurzen Spielzeit und es ist zudem auch noch Kostenlos also gibt es einen Daumen nach Oben

author: {'steamid': '76561198027102438', 'num_games_owned': 1328, 'num_reviews': 156, 'playtime_forever': 88, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1650714493}
review:
Yes, this is another one of those indie horror titles you can complete in an hour or so, which we all know very well by now.
Although those are usually pretty crappy, I was surprised by this one in a good way.
This is not a horror masterpiece but it certainly has its moments. I mainly found the puzzles to be pretty good, mostly. They're all light and some are mediocre, but there were also good ones which make the game worth a try, if that's your thing. Of course they wouldn't spare us from a chase scene and a "avoid-the-monster" chore, but I found those enjoyable as well in this case.
The rest of the technical aspects were pretty fine as well, I thought the soundtrack and sfx were fitting and of OK quality. The graphics are nice for the time of release and for the fact that it's an indie game. The whole hunted mansion thing is well realized here, and even if it's not the creepiest title, I still thought the graphics were at the very least pleasing to the eye.

Unfortunately I thought the back story was really weak, I didn't have much patience to take seriously the notes scattered around, as they felt to provide very thin detail and value.
I got this game back when it still costed money and got around to it only by now (Here's a lesson about enlarging your backlog too soon), but anyway - as a free game, it's totally worth a try if you like the GOOD indie horror titles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061249750', 'num_games_owned': 1173, 'num_reviews': 168, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1649520564}
review:
Kraven Manor isn't scary. As an indie venture, it's got some creative ideas and I love nothing more than exploring spooky mansions in my horror games, but the most emotion it made me feel was mildly intrigued. The best I can say is that I love the room shifting mechanic, where you can mix and match rooms like puzzle pieces to solve minor environmental puzzles, sort of. The problem with this game is two-fold; Absolutely abhorrent optimization, and an incredibly obnoxious monster, that is neither scary nor original. The atmosphere is the best part of Kraven Manor, and it's clear a lot of love went into the environments that make this games stand out from it's other predecessors from the "Amnesia" age of horror. Unfortunately, even though it rips its monster design from the now overused "look away and it will move and hurt you!!1!" it doesn't really follow the fairest rules in how it attacks, as your flashlight works on some sort of timer when in the presence of the monster, causing the screen to go black in the darker areas of the game and for you to take nearly unavoidable damage, as even if you are looking at the creature, it can apparently move in the dark, until your flashlight comes on. When the happens, the only real solution you have is to move yourself away at a light jog, but this is inconsistent at best. The sound design could've been better, as it rides a fine line between atmospheric and grating--especially when it comes to the squeaky joints of the monster and the obnoxious scary music sting queues. The devolopers clearly wanted this to be a scary and surprising experience, but the only emotions it ever got from me were a mix of annoyance and bemusement. I would also recommend you turn the volume down before you get started, because the audio balancing is atrocious.

The other unfortunate reality is that unlike a lot of its contemporaries at the time, there isn't much reason to explore either. While there are indeed some minor lore bits scattered about as well as some rather pretentious easter eggs (You can actually find a copy of Paradise Lost among the clutter, for example) the environments, big or small, are designed to guide you down a very specific pathway where it can perform some middle school haunted house scares on you as you navigate to the next "puzzle." I put puzzle in quotes, because the most interesting and charming one was throwing a bunch of small wine caskets into a big barrel to get a piece of glass to lift up. Casketball, if you will. I feel like describing it like that belies some sort of charming self-awareness to the silly puzzles found in other spooky mansion games, but this is not the case. After you solve said puzzle and get your reward, there is a chase sequence of sorts, and then you're back in the main hall.
In my 20 minutes of playing, I saw this formula play out about 4 times, and after Casketball I was done. 

Even as a free to play game, this is hard for me to really recommend to anyone except the most fledgling horror fans, but it definitely has its charm--if you can get past the weird loading hitches and annoying monster. The story is nothing to write about, but underneath the more questionable design decisions there is a lot of potential to the smaller ideas sprinkled about that don't wholesale crib from other, more effective horror games, and I would recommend it worth being played as more of a curiosity of yesteryears horror than a game of any fear factor. Especially compared to a lot of the shlock that came out at the time, this one at least attempted something unique and is an impressive student offering with some really lovely set design and models, and that is worth commending.  Also, kudos to the devs for making this a free to play game when it, from what I understand, used to have a dollar sign next to it.

I personally don't recommend it to a broader audience as the game functions like a more fleshed out proof of concept, but if you're interested in what I've described and want to see it for yourself, or have any interest in making a horror game yourself, this is an interesting case study that has a fascinating balance of bad and good. However, as someone who was playing casually, it lost my interest quickly. Definitely more of a "maybe," but unfortunately leaning to "no."

author: {'steamid': '76561198113848693', 'num_games_owned': 1170, 'num_reviews': 347, 'playtime_forever': 336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 336, 'last_played': 1649016421}
review:
[h1]Comentario Rob√≥tico-Anal√≠tico: "Kraven Manor"[/h1]

En un 2014 en el que el auge de Amnesia: The Dark Descent segu√≠a vigente y el mercado ya hac√≠a rato se hab√≠a saturado de t√≠tulos de terror similares, Kraven Manor fue una miles de propuestas que tuvieron quiz√° un par de d√≠as de popularidad para luego quedar en el olvido.

Ya habiendo pasado tanto tiempo, sabiendo el contexto en que sali√≥, ¬øse sostiene como un buen juego? Bueno, en principio s√≠. La experiencia sigue contando con momentos tensos, pero no sabe hacer un uso apropiado de su (excelente) atm√≥sfera y al terminar, que terminar√° r√°pido, parecer√° que podr√≠a haber sido m√°s. Adem√°s la dificultad es muy leve y el juego est√° plagado de bugs.

Es el apartado visual y musical el que lo hace brillar, realmente es atmosf√©rico. Pero la interacci√≥n con el entorno es ocasional y cuando ocurre, apenas ofrece un desaf√≠o ni nada que aporte algo. Por otra parte sabe mantener al jugador tenso desde el comienzo.

[b]¬øEn conclusi√≥n?[/b] Es un juego decente, pero hay mejores opciones. Ahora mismo es gratuito (Jurar√≠a recordar que cuando lo adquir√≠, era de pago) y por su corta duraci√≥n no falla en lo que ofrece.

review: Kraven manor es a todas luces un claro intento de recrear la esencia de Amnesia The Dark Descent, con un resultado bastante lamentable. Si bien se proponen ideas muy interesantes, estas a su vez, terminan fungiendo mas c√≥mo un arma de doble filo al despotricar por completo la propia jugabilidad. Haciendo de un lastre cualquier tipo de conexi√≥n di√©getica debido a que se vuelve injugable, ya que cosas como la imposibilidad de saltar o la estamina que dura al rededor de tan solo 7 segundos en los momentos mas "tensos" terminan siendo un obst√°culo mas permisivo hac√≠a la frustraci√≥n que a otra cosa: 5,5/10.

review: Great short horror experience! The graphics are decent, they used some interesting game mechanics and it also has scary parts. - Bulmacalarƒ± keyifliydi. √úcretsiz bir oyunda beklemediƒüim d√ºzeyde √ºst√ºne d√º≈ü√ºn√ºlm√º≈üt√º. Lakin, bu bulmacalarƒ±n zor olduƒüu anlamƒ±na gelmiyor. Korkarken yapmak biraz daha zor olduƒüundan bence tam kƒ±vamƒ±nda bir zorluƒüa d√∂n√º≈üm√º≈ü oluyor.
- Karakterin yorulunca √ßƒ±kardƒ±ƒüƒ± nefes alma sesi, ilk duyduƒüumda beni korkutmu≈ütu. Az sessiz nefes al.

author: {'steamid': '76561198281253410', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 351, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1635900344}
review:
I originally bought this game back in 2016 and played it for about 30 minutes before getting frustrated by repeat deaths and quitting.

Fast forward to 2021. The rona has ravaged 0.00000000000036% of the world's population. America has a inarticulate pants-pooping Alzheimer's patient for a President. All hope seems lost. Then I remembered that I had never finished Kraven Manor.

I reload the game and got done with it about 2 hours later. Not bad. Some good jumpscares, a few puzzles, good atmosphere. I actually enjoyed it this time around.

Rating: 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198260558677', 'num_games_owned': 73, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1637693175}
review:
This is a game I have had sitting in my library uninstalled for the longest time, so I decided to give it a play! As with every time I review something, I am only stating my honest opinions, and to anyone reading this, you are free to agree or disagree with me. Let's get started!

THE GOOD:
- Visually good looking
- Unique overarching puzzle
- Legitimately scary (which is kind of the defining feature in whether a horror game is worth playing)
- Main enemies premise is relatively simple, yet effective. (without spoiling anything)
- Relatively short (~1 hour long), good for a one-off play-through if you have about an hour to kill

THE NEUTRAL:
- some of the sounds seemed to only ever play in one side of my headphones (mainly the thunder in the main room)
- several objects that you could pick up seemed important, but were ultimately useless as far as I could tell (unless maybe they were for an alternate ending or easter-egg, which I clearly didn't find lol)

THE BAD:
- While the story and lore is very present in this game, and you can put together how the enemies came to be if you pay attention, there didn't seem to be any explanation whatsoever as to why the protagonist was in the Kraven Manor in the first place, which kind of annoys me. 
- I wasn't a huge fan of the "finale" scene (finale scene meaning the "final battle"/last game-play moment, not to be confused with the ending) and I think the first person play style of the game didn't work well with the nature of it. (again, trying not to spoil anything)

Overall, I'd say Kraven Manor is worth playing, it's a short horror game that manages to scare you most of the time, and has its own form of subtlety/unexpectedness to it. I like the overarching puzzle as well, and I don't think I've seen anything quite like it in any game I've played! 

I give Kraven Manor 7/10, if you have around an hour of free time to kill, and like scary games, then it's worth giving this one a shot!

author: {'steamid': '76561198002637002', 'num_games_owned': 781, 'num_reviews': 357, 'playtime_forever': 191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 191, 'last_played': 1632741052}
review:
Kraven Manor is a horror game with light puzzle elements and some fitting action segments.

Pros
+ Interesting story, told visually and through notes.
+ Very interesting rooms mechanic.
+ Intense, in that good horror way.
+ Atmospheric.
+ Good visuals.
+ Actually somewhat scary.
+ Few cheap jumpscares.
+ Two endings that are both well done.
+ Two "difficulties" for slightly different experiences.
+ Good autosave feature.
+ Good repertoire of acheivements.
+ Free!

Cons
- Could've had more and more varied puzzles.
- Some of the few puzzles were rather weak.
- Rooms mechanic could've been explored further.
- Sometimes crashed during loading.
- Lack of intuitivity in regards to how the game worked puzzle wise, especially early on.
- Some cues and hints for certain situations could've been improved.

All in all a very good game that I highly recommend checking out! It does have some flaws, and is a bit rough around the edges, but not so much as many other indie games I've played. Overall, this is very well made!

All achievements took me roughly three hours total. For other achievement hunters, I suggest starting with Nightmare mode and doing the regular ending first, then doing a no damage run on Normal with the secret ending after.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969267147', 'num_games_owned': 7582, 'num_reviews': 572, 'playtime_forever': 132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1628307536}
review:
Awful gameplay and many crashes make this a hard thumbs down from me, which is too bad because there is an interesting structural concept here.

The awfulness is mostly due to the chase scenes. They are many, frustrating, and repetitive. Also awful is that you have no inventory, and generally items are hard to see and finicky to manipulate. My "favorite" part is when the game crashes (there are only auto-saves, and there are too few of them) and then I have to repeat the chase scene.

The story is ... fine. But it's also woefully underdeveloped due to this game being so, so short. If they had more time the graduate students who made this game might have been able to flesh it out into something intriguing. As it stands, it's skin deep.

Oh, and there are two endings, one of which is pretty much only achievable with a walkthrough. And you have to follow the walkthrough from the start, because there is a point-of-no-return after which you would have to restart the game in order to get that ending. I do not find that satisfying at all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198990949242', 'num_games_owned': 692, 'num_reviews': 219, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1619969454}
review:
While this is listed as a game, its more of a short demo. You can beat it in about 40 minutes. However I enjoyed my time with it, has some cool concepts, for example in the lobby of the mansion there is a board, you obtain "Room Pieces" that you can attach to the board and that changes where and how you enter each room, leaving me a sense that I still did not uncover all the game secrets as I did not try every combination on my playthrough. 

If you google this game, you will get lots of videos/articles calling it the "scariest game ever" but its actually not scary at all, your only enemy are bronze statues that copy the Doctor Who idea of "Weeping Angels" aka enemies only move if you are not looking at them. This whole idea of this game being scary was started by the cancer that has become YouTube where people livestream a "horror" game and exaggerate and fake their reactions for views, and I guess it just became a meme.

So while I do recommend you play this if you are looking for a free demo with some cool concepts and enjoyable puzzles, I dont recommend you grab it if you are looking for a scare... you will be disappointed. Unless you have some sort of phobia of bronze statues I guess? Cause that is all you will be seeing here. And no, jump scares do not count as "scary", they are just lazy ways to label your game as horror.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992135044', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1618858942}
review:
What may be seen at first as a Amnesia clone is actually a quite interesting and polished short horror story. 

The unique enemy mechanic, where they can move only while you're not looking at them, works pretty well and provide plenty of tension and scary moments.

The ability to change the Manor's layout, while interesting at first, does not really affect the experience. Apart from this, most of the puzzles are decent, if at times unclear.

I was impressed by the amount of polish some scenes presented, particularly towards the end, and would definitely recommend the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961017729', 'num_games_owned': 3004, 'num_reviews': 3428, 'playtime_forever': 988, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 948, 'last_played': 1705582547}
review: Kraven Manor seems like an unassuming old Unreal Engine 3 game, but it's actually quite grand. You puzzle and jumpscare your way through a castle and it's got this scary brass slenderman who only moves when you aren't looking. Simple and clean. The house has some weird system where you encounter new rooms by placing their model on a table in the main room, which is pretty cool, but I'd just rather have some huge house. It's still technically very cool. This might have been another one of those f2p's I tried to plow my way through before bed time, and I think I got close, I don't remember. [spoiler]This title is graphically before the days of PBR and such, it looks all Bioshock-y, which I think itself started as an Unreal Engine 2 game? Hell I don't know. I'm gonna go look up what engine the original bioshock used right now, you watch me.[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11207, 'playtime_forever': 120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1634397895}
review:
This is a 3D first person adventure/puzzle game made with the Unreal engine where you explore a haunted mansion to solve the puzzles and survive the jumpscares. 

This was put together by a bunch of grad students but the quality here is exceptional.  It's a great showcase for what the venerable Unreal engine can do.   Visuals and audio are professional quality, and despite being 6 years old, this is better than most indie games on the market.   The best part?  It's completely free.   There's no reason not to add this to your game library, even if the game is a bit short, it's a great experience. 

I'm pretty sure the grad students involved with this project have gone on to make great contributions to the gaming industry.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020930052', 'num_games_owned': 556, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1598769973}
review:
So this was a really cool game. I managed to complete it within two hours. You can probably speed run it easily. Overall it was a very interesting game. Had a great story and wonderfully creepy atmosphere. It relied a bit more on jumpscares than I was led to believe, but eh what are you gonna do? This was made by thirteen people which is pretty impressive because it looks great (plus they are from Texas so WOO). The puzzles were interesting as well! I had a couple of issues. First was the running mechanic. It very much did not let you sprint enough. My next issues involve spoilers so:
*SPOILERS*
First there was the sudden boss battle where you have to run from the statue within a glass maze sort of thing. I died several times because the game didn't give an indication that you can actually stop the creature with your flashlight at that point like you could previously except in your journal. Since checking the journal does not pause the game, it felt foolish to check it during a part that very clearly wanted you to run. Then there was the sudden laser blasts it started shooting out? It felt very odd and out of place with the atmosphere it had been building at that point. After that it stopped being scary and puzzle solving and turned into a sort of fighting thing where you had to get the lasers to hit these magic orbs of some kind. Then the final boss battle came where you had to annoyingly time their hits with moving balls. Overall it just felt out of place and weird with everything leading up to that point. I was really enjoying the scary, creepy atmosphere and puzzle solving up to that point and a semi-platformer boss battle was not what I had in mind when going in to the game.
*SPOILERS END*
Overall, I'd definitely recommend the game to people. It was fun and killed some time, definitely scared me multiple times.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037839153', 'num_games_owned': 305, 'num_reviews': 297, 'playtime_forever': 141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1594018952}
review:
[b]Mroczna posiad≈Ço≈õƒá[/b]
Kraven Manor to typowy przedstawiciel swojego gatunku. Niestety gra wrzuca Nas za drzwi posiad≈Ço≈õci bez ≈ºadnego wprowadzenia stƒÖd trudno jest siƒô zorientowaƒá od razu z czym Nam przyjdzie siƒô tak naprawdƒô zmierzyƒá. Mimo takiej niedogodno≈õci pierwsze wra≈ºenia sƒÖ zdecydowanie pozytywne. Choƒá poczƒÖtek mo≈ºe byƒá spokojny to stojƒÖcy na schodach manekin w≈Ça≈õciwie utrzymuje nastr√≥j niepokoju, nawet w pozornie komfortowych warunkach.
[b]Pierwszy zgrzyt[/b]
Zanim faktycznie zaczniemy siƒô baƒá na pewno rozglƒÖdajƒÖc siƒô po posiad≈Ço≈õci podniesiemy czy to ksiƒÖ≈ºkƒô czy jaki≈õ dzbanek. Tym samym szybko zorientujemy siƒô ≈ºe obs≈Çuga przedmiot√≥w nie stoi na najwy≈ºszym poziomie. Samo przenoszenie jest raczej poprawne (o ile uda Nam siƒô go z≈Çapaƒá) ale puszczenie przedmiotu powoduje tu jaki≈õ dziwny podskok prowadzonej przez Nas postaci (na szczƒô≈õcie manipulacji przedmiotami nie jest tutaj za du≈ºo). Dodatkowo ka≈ºdy zauwa≈ºy ≈ºe podpowiedzi wprowadzone przez Tw√≥rc√≥w sprawiajƒÖ ≈ºe nieraz mamy na ekranie kilka ≈õwiecƒÖcych przedmiot√≥w co choƒá pomaga (bo nie musimy siƒô zastanawiaƒá czy jest interakcja czy nie) to miejscami mo≈ºe rozpraszaƒá skupionego na ka≈ºdym kroku Gracza.
[b]Co≈õ tu nie gra[/b]
To czym Kraven Manor niewƒÖtpliwie by przyciƒÖga≈Ç (gdyby wykonane by≈Ço nale≈ºycie) to spos√≥b obchodzenia siƒô z tutejszym "z≈Çym". Samo utrzymywanie przeciwnika w zasiƒôgu wzroku nie jest trudne natomiast jego reakcja w momencie Naszych dzia≈Ça≈Ñ wymagajƒÖcych odwr√≥cenia siƒô od niego plecami jest ju≈º bardzo niesprawiedliwa (nie wspominajƒÖc ju≈º o tym co on wyprawia w bibliotece). Do tego gra typowo operuje ≈õwiat≈Çem (gasi je w wygodnych dla Tw√≥rc√≥w momentach) co w tych bardziej stresowych sytuacjach jest r√≥wnie≈º du≈ºym nadu≈ºyciem oraz sprawia ≈ºe gra mo≈ºe odpychaƒá. 
[b]Zagadkowy poziom[/b]
Gra jak na horror utrzymuje odpowiedni poziom zagadek (generalnie sƒÖ proste choƒá jest te≈º co≈õ bardziej wymagajƒÖcego) ale mimo to mechaniki wymagajƒÖce zachowania odpowiedniej kolejno≈õci sƒÖ ca≈Çkowicie pozbawione logiki co niewƒÖtpliwie pogorszy odbi√≥r przez tych bardziej wymagajƒÖcych. Do tego podzia≈Ç na poziomy trudno≈õci jest niezrozumia≈Çy, co prawda r√≥≈ºnica jest spora bo "koszmar" przesadnie ogranicza jasno≈õƒá pomieszcze≈Ñ, limituje d≈Çugo≈õƒá ≈õwiecenia latarki oraz znacznie przyspiesza czas reakcji "z≈Çego" ale to nie wp≈Çywa na poziom generowanego poprzez grƒô strachu a jedynie mƒôczy w rozgrywce.
[b]Kwestia wykonania[/b]
Choƒá nie przepadam za tego typu grami to Kraven Manor pod wzglƒôdem pomys≈Çu na miejsce akcji (podobne jak np. w filmie "Dom w g≈Çƒôbi lasu") i fabu≈Çƒô (z dwoma r√≥wnie satysfakcjonujƒÖcymi choƒá r√≥≈ºnymi zako≈Ñczeniami) by≈Çbym w stanie poleciƒá. Niestety jako ≈ºe jest to gra i musi spe≈Çniaƒá pewne normy to poleciƒá jej nie mogƒô. Wprowadzona mechanika "z≈Çego" po prostu jest tragicznie wykonana i nie dzia≈Ça tak jak powinna a problemy z interakcjƒÖ z obiektami ostatecznie muszƒÖ zdyskwalifikowaƒá ten tytu≈Ç. Do tego gra mo≈ºe siƒô "zepsuƒá". Raz bƒôdƒÖ to zamkniƒôte a jedyne w pomieszczeniu drzwi a raz skrypt dotyczƒÖcy kluczowego przedmiotu (czƒô≈õƒá makiety) kt√≥ry siƒô nie odpali. Naprawdƒô szkoda.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021800223', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 476, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1589496394}
review:
Pretty good and short puzzle game with unique idea of using puzzle pieces to transform a whole rooms of Mansion.
Kinda shame it's a bit short - around 60 minutes to finish it.
There few achievements, secret ending and Nightmare Mode to add a bit of replayability tho. 

To be honest Nighmare mode adding mechanical flashlight makes the game way more tense and interesting then regular mode.
The secret ending is kinda garbage and super hidden but its fun to try and get it on your own.

I just wish the last sequence of the game wasn't so ......well, lame with all that fire, walking on levitating books, t-posing dolls shooting spirit bombs at you and floating metalic balls sucking souls of angry faces.

Final moments could be done way better.
Same with story of this game.

For a simple 60 minutes long game, I found 3 very annoying game breaking glitches:

1) entire area did not loaded making me need to reload a checkpoint and losing 15 minutes of progress,

2) the game didn't do a "ghost levitating room piece to target location" thingy making me confused on what am I supposed to do in the game. 
After 20 minutes of running around the manor I did check the internet guide to find out that the game just glitched out. 
So I reloaded a checkpoint, had to re-do a whole library part again and then the game actually allowed me to progress the game because the glitch did not happen,

3) whole game did go in very rough black and white vision at the end of the game while disallowing me from using a flashlight making the game almost unplayable.
The only thing that fixed it is progressing with zero visibility forward to the final area (which took around 15 minutes of me bumping into walls like an idiot)
with lowered graphics setting, brightness at max and dying multiple times, 

Overall: its a good game for what is worth.

Definitely recommended!

review: Let me first say that I played the game now that it is free, so I didn't buy it like most people. Now that is out of the way, the game itself is wonderful, it's great. It will surpass your expectations for being an indie game. I do have 2 problems, one which it will frustrate to beat the game without getting damage (achievement) as the AI tends to spawn behind you as you further distance yourself to it. The other (and most disappointedly) is how *SHORT* the game is. Other than that, the atmosphere, music and the puzzles mix perfectly. I'd say now is your chance to give this game a try ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198168260477', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1589337249}
review: I really like this one.  It's a bit of a walking simulator in that there isn't much in the way of puzzles, although the few that are presented are decent and implement the gameplay mechanics in a neat way.  For example, it's exhilarating trying to keep the enemy in view while feeling along walls for switches.  I plan on revisiting soon to play with the modular rooms system a bit more, too.  It's a bit buggy, however, and forced me to load checkpoints so that scripted events would trigger properly.  If you're into horror and atmosphere and find yourself with an hour or so to kill, give this one a try.

review:
Kraven Manor √© um bom jogo de suspense. Os gr√°ficos s√£o √≥timos, feitos na Unreal Engine. A jogabilidade √© simples (poderia ser um pouco melhor trabalhada), mas √© eficiente. E algo que eu sempre digo a respeito do som e trilha sonora, √© que eles fazem muita diferen√ßa no jogo. Kraven Manor tem m√∫sicas √≥timas que empolgam na hora da correria. Os puzzles do jogo s√£o bem f√°ceis e intuitivos. No quesito terror, no come√ßo n√£o tava sentindo muito medo. O cen√°rio em si n√£o tava dando margem pra isso, mas a partir de um certo momento eu comecei a ficar bem tenso e posso dizer que tomei uns sustinhos bons. 

O jogo n√£o parece ter uma hist√≥ria muito elaborada, voc√™ apenas est√° l√° numa mans√£o e tem que tentar sair dela (pelo menos √© isso que parece que o personagem est√° tentando fazer). 

Pra mim, o √∫nico ponto negativo √© que o jogo √© bem curto, terminei em 1 hora. Na verdade isso n√£o chega a ser um ponto negativo, mas ao meu ver, Kraven Manor poderia ter sido algo bem maior, n√£o em quest√£o de dura√ß√£o, mas em quest√£o de status mesmo.

review: Pocas veces un juego me ha sacudido tanto los nervios de la tensi√≥n como este juego. La mec√°nica es muy sencilla, somos un hombre que entra en una casa algo extra√±a, encontramos una maqueta de un ala de la casa y descubrimos que encaja en la maqueta de la entrada y... de repente ese ala se materializa donde lo pusimos. Pero no todo ser√° dar vueltas por la casa buscando trozos de maqueta, pues unas misteriosas estatuas de bronce nos perseguir√°n para no dejarnos salir con vida. El juego es gratuito en este momento y para siempre, ¬°y menudo regalazo que hacen a la gente! Es un juego que trabaja muy bien la tensi√≥n (esas estatuas que se mueven solo cuando no las miras son puro Doctor Who) y que graficamente es bastante aceptable. Su mayor pero es que dura poco m√°s de 1 hora si no sabes lo que hacer, pero siendo gratis...

review:
[h1][b] Kraven Manor[/b][/h1]
tenho Kraven Manor em minha biblioteca h√° muito tempo por√©m nunca dei uma chance, na verdade nem me lembro quando o comprei, alguns dias atr√°s resolvi dar uma aten√ß√£o ao mesmo e n√£o me arrependi nenhum um pouco.

[h1]Gr√°ficos e Sonoriza√ß√£o[/h1]
[b]Gr√°ficos: 8/10[/b]
Os gr√°ficos do jogo s√£o simples e bons, textura e modelos. O jogo tamb√©m possui uma √≥tima ilumina√ß√£o e ambiente, oi jogo √© escuro no tom certo e nos ambientes iluminados a ilumina√ß√£o faz bem o seu papel, o design da mans√£o √© bem elaborado.

[b]Sonoriza√ß√£o: 8/10[/b]
A sonoriza√ß√£o do jogo √© √≥tima, as m√∫sicas de ajudam bem na atmosfera do jogo e a sonoriza√ß√£o geral do jogo √© muito bem feita.

[h1]Hist√≥ria e Atmosfera[/h1]
[b]Hist√≥ria: 4/10[/b]
Kraven Manor na verdade n√£o tem uma hist√≥ria, voc√™ chega em uma mans√£o e atrav√©s de anota√ß√µes que encontra voc√™ entende um pouco sobre a hist√≥ria mas mesmo assim quase nada, n√£o h√° cenas ou di√°logos. O enredo fica aberto a interpreta√ß√£o do jogador. E o jogo √© bem curto dando cerca de 1h30 de jogo.

[b]Atmosfera: 10/10[/b]
A atmosfera do jogo √© perfeita, o ambiente, a sonoriza√ß√£o, a ilumina√ß√£o, tudo no jogo te d√° uma atmosfera de terror psicol√≥gico, al√©m de manter uma sensa√ß√£o de terror constante, durante o jogo todo voc√™ tem aquela sensa√ß√£o arrepiante esperando que algo aconte√ßa.

[h1]Mec√¢nica e Desempenho[/h1]
[b]Mec√¢nica: 10/10[/b]
O jogo possui uma jogabilidade simples, movimento, corre, lanterna e pegar objetos. Por√©m o jogo tem duas mec√¢nicas interessantes, a primeira √© mec√¢nica da mans√£o, durante o jogo voc√™ vai encontrar modelos de maquete os quias voc√™ pode levar para a mesa no sal√£o principal e montar a maquete, conforme voc√™ posiciona o modelo na maquete o design do jogo muda, √© voc√™ quem decidi o design da mans√£o de acordo com a forma que voc√™ monta a maquete. E a segunda √© a mec√¢nica de combate que lembra um pouco os weeping angels de Doctor Who, n√£o √© algo inovador j√° que existem outros jogos com essa mesma mec√¢nica.

[b]Desempenho: 8/10[/b]
Durante o jogo todo n√£o encontrei nenhum bug e pude jogar o jogo todo sem nenhum travamento ou algo que atrapalhasse o jogo.

[h1]Considera√ß√µes Finais[/h1]
Kraven Manor nasceu de um projeto de alguns estudantes, e conforme foi ganhando notoriedade eles decidiram montar um est√∫dio e fazer um jogo completo. √â um jogo bem simples, sem um enredo elaborado, apenas dois tipos de inimigo e bem r√°pido em menos de 2h voc√™ finaliza o jogo, por√©m faz o seu papel de terror muito bem feito, tem uma √≥tima atmosfera que chega a ser melhor que muitos jogos de grandes desenvolvedoras e traz uma √≥tima experi√™ncia. Comprei esse jogo em algum bundle quando ainda era pago, agora que √© gratuito aproveite pois √© um √≥timo jogo e vai te proporcionar uma √≥tima experi√™nica.

[b]Nota Final: [u]8/10[/u][/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561197963377064', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 402, 'playtime_forever': 581, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 212, 'last_played': 1585269131}
review:
Made by a small student team, certainly fans of Amnesia: The Dark Descent, Kraven Manor is a short but intense game with original ideas.
The background is nice & the overall design well made.
It's free so if you like Amnesia try this one to get about an hour of fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198190380543', 'num_games_owned': 613, 'num_reviews': 603, 'playtime_forever': 121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1584394790}
review: Kraven Manor may seem like a generic horror survival game, and while it‚Äôs not a great game by any means, it‚Äôs one that I enjoyed playing through. One thing working in its favor is the length. Your first playthrough will last around one hour, but it‚Äôs an intense hour, let me tell ya. The game is compact, consisting of various rooms that you can collect and arrange in the main lobby in order to progress. The game has the right atmosphere most of the time, you need to play it with headphones, and the graphics just get the job done. There‚Äôs even a story that it‚Äôs not bad at all. You have some replay value with an extra, secret ending, a harder difficulty and achievements. But even then, it‚Äôs not a long game. And since it‚Äôs free, it‚Äôs a nice experience if you‚Äôre a fan of the genre and have an hour to fill. I was really surprised by it.

review: Kraven Manor jest horrorem na jedno posiedzenie. Jest grƒÖ tylko na 2 godziny, ale ma sw√≥j kilmat grozy. Musimy modyfikowaƒá uk≈Çad domu za pomocƒÖ makiety na parterze i rozwiƒÖzujemy proste zagadki logiczne. Uciekamy przed figurkƒÖ z brƒÖzu, co z poczƒÖtku nie wydaje siƒô takie straszne, ale przez obecny w grze soundtrack jest przera≈ºajƒÖce. Przeszed≈Çem tƒÖ grƒô i ba≈Çem siƒô przechodziƒá jƒÖ po raz drugi by jƒÖ wymaksowaƒá.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031163623', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1571031235}
review:
This might sound like a dumb thing to say, but if this game were just slightly better in every way it'd be decent. What I mean is that if the gameplay, plot, graphics, atmosphere, scares, coding, and game mechanics were all just slightly better the game would be very playable. The best aspect of the game is actually the music which captures the horror tone quite well, if not a little generically.

As it is, though, it feels like a short (~1.5 hrs) and rough-around-the-edges horror game. I was surprised at the end credits to see so many people contributed to the game since it feels like the sort of thing that would be made by a single person. I later found out that this was actually a college project, and that makes a LOT of sense.

As a now free to play experience, I feel safe giving it a low (6/10) recommend, but don't set your expectations too high.

author: {'steamid': '76561198427374354', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 244, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1559763277}
review: Can't say I enjoyed Kraven Manor much. Though it's a short game, I stopped playing 45 minutes in, when I kept dying, trapped in some dark room. It's an amateurishly made game, with clunky controls and a cliched haunted Victorian mansion theme. I suppose it's not a terrible game, for an indie effort probably put together by a handful of people, but for me, it was barely enjoyable even before the recurring deaths. Anyway, it's a free game, so you might give it a try regardless. Worst case, quit if it gets tedious. I did.

author: {'steamid': '76561198108967579', 'num_games_owned': 256, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1582281970}
review:
[PT-BR]

T√° ai um game que me surpreendeu muito, n√£o esperava nada dele segundo alguns coment√°rios que li. Kraven Manor √© um jogo indie de terror com puzzles, basicamente voc√™ est√° no interior da mans√£o abandonada que d√° nome √† obra e precisa explorar seus segredos e sobreviver a seus desafios.
√â bem curto, 1h de gameplay, intuitivo e f√°cil, mas garante bons sustos, eu mesmo fiquei angustiado v√°rias vezes ao entrar em locais muito escuros.
Em termos de enredo, o jogo √© direto: voc√™ est√° no interior da mans√£o abandonada e precisa explorar seus segredos e sobreviver a seus desafios. N√£o h√° uma introdu√ß√£o nem constru√ß√£o de personagem. Voc√™ tanto pode ser um herdeiro em busca de respostas sobre seus antepassados ou um simples desafortunado que furou o pneu do carro do lado de fora e entrou para dar um telefonema. Talvez haja um texto de abertura que explique isso, mas os detalhes me fogem completamente diante da noite de tormento passada ali.
O jogo n√£o √© dif√≠cil, muito pelo contr√°rio, seus enigmas s√£o f√°ceis de resolver e a equipe de desenvolvedores se preocupou em fornecer muitas dicas para voc√™ n√£o se perder no que precisa ser feito.

NOTA: 7.5/10

[EN]

A game that surprised me a lot, I didn't expect anything from it according to some comments I read. Kraven Manor is an indie horror game with puzzles, basically you're inside the abandoned mansion that gives the work its name and need to explore its secrets and survive its challenges.
It is very short, 1h of gameplay, intuitive and easy, but it guarantees good scares, I myself was distressed several times when entering very dark places.
In terms of the plot, the game is straightforward: you are inside the abandoned mansion and need to explore its secrets and survive its challenges. There is no introduction or character building. You can either be an heir in search of answers about your ancestors or a simple unfortunate person who punctured the car tire outside and went in to make a phone call. Perhaps there is an opening text that explains this, but the details elude me completely in the face of the night of torment spent there.
The game is not difficult, quite the contrary, its puzzles are easy to solve and the team of developers has taken care to provide many tips so you don't get lost in what needs to be done.

NOTE: 7.5/10

[RU-RU]

review:
C'est sous une pluie battante, entre coup√©e de lugubres coups de tonnerre rendant l'atmosph√®re pesante, que vous d√©barquez dans ce sombre manoir abandonn√©. A mesure que vous avancez timidement dans le grand hall d'entr√©e, vous apercevez en son centre, un imposant pr√©sentoir en verre, abritant une myst√©rieuse maquette inachev√©e...

Peu rassur√©, mais bloqu√© ici par la temp√™te qui n'en fini pas, vous d√©cidez d'explorer cette morne demeure, sans vous douter que la pire des aventures vous y attend.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1701929535


https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1701165569


Un concept offrant quelques √©l√©ments de gameplay int√©ressants, des graphismes et une bande son tr√®s bien r√©alis√©s, ce jeu est d'une courte dur√©e mais assez intense, le sc√©nario semble plut√¥t basique au premier abord mais n'est pas mauvais pour autant et inclue une fin secr√®te.

Les amateurs de jeux d'horreur auraient certainement appr√©ci√© un plus haut niveau de frayeurs, et les aventuriers quelques √©nigmes bien plac√©es ainsi qu'une histoire un peu plus longue. 
Pour moi c'est petit jeu √† prendre tel qu'il est pour quelques heures d'amusement bien sympathiques.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078728930', 'num_games_owned': 258, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 147, 'last_played': 1545937599}
review:
Es un juego corto y con mucho potencial. Les creo cuando dicen que ha inspirado a otros videojuegos. Sus logros son algo complicados de conseguir, especialmente porque los maniqu√≠es son muy r√°pidos y la mec√°nica de detenerlos con la mirada no siempre es √∫til (algunas veces reaparecen detr√°s del personaje, aunque me parece que el truco est√° en la distancia entre nuestro personaje y el maniqu√≠: si √©l est√° muy lejos, se teletransportar√°, por decirlo de alg√∫n modo, de lo contrario no lo har√°).
Por otro lado, el juego tiene ciertos problemas de rendimiento, pues hay zonas donde los fps se van por el piso. Y en cuanto a bugs, encontr√© dos: el primero tiene que ver con uno de los modelos de la casa que, al momento de ponerlo en la mesa, se buge√≥ y qued√≥ flotando a mi lado, de modo que era imposible utilizarlo (cada vez que lo intentaba recoger, interactuaba con la mesa en su lugar); el segundo fue llegando al final, cuando deb√≠a tomar la palanca para entrar a la zona secreta de la casa. Resulta que la palanca no estaba, por lo que intent√© devolverme, para que finalmente el juego crasheara y me devolviera al escritorio de windows. Afortunadamente, cuando regres√© al juego, la palanca tambi√©n.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052227260', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1533667025}
review:
[h1]Sch√∂ner, kurzer Horrortrip[/h1]

Kraven Manor ist wohl ein Studentenprojekt, aber was jetzt erstmal komisch klingt, ist gut umgesetzt.
Man spielt in der Egoperspektive in einem alten Herrenhaus und l√∂st dort einfache R√§tsel. Mal einen Hebel umlegen oder eine Kiste verschieben, um an ein Teil zu gelangen, was einen immer ein St√ºckchen tiefer in den Bauch des Hauses bringt.

Die Grafik basiert auf der Unity-Engine und wirkt teilweise etwas verwaschen oder unscharf. Das passt aber trotzdem ziemlich gut zum rustikalen, altbackenen Ambiente, dass das Haus verspr√ºht.

Der Sound ist passend und der ein oder andere kleine Erschrecker ist dabei. Die Musik nervt nicht, ist aber auch nichts weltbewegendes.

Die Steuerung ist einfach, da man nur Standardtasten nutzt und dementsprechend fl√ºssig ist das Spielgef√ºhl. Die Speicherpunkte sind recht gut gesetzt und Frust kommt eigentlich nie auf. 

Alles in allem kann ich Kraven Manor mit gutem Gewissen empfehlen f√ºr die, die Lust auf einen kurzen (~2h) Horrortrip haben. Man kann auch ruhig nebenbei mal was trinken ohne Angst vor Jumpscares haben zu m√ºssen, dass man alles vor Schreck √ºber den Monitor prusten muss. :-)

-----
Weitere Reviews findet Ihr hier: [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/germanicusreviewius] GermanReviews [/url]

Contiene una atm√≥sfera de constante persecuci√≥n psicol√≥gica, acertijos simples (que requieren de pensamiento r√°pido en ciertas situaciones) y un dise√±o de escenario magn√≠fico.

author: {'steamid': '76561198212505048', 'num_games_owned': 1738, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 250, 'last_played': 1527014748}
review:
[h1] A Good Indie Horror Game:	[/h1]
Kraven Manor is a first-person horror adventure, in which the titular building is the central puzzle. The central conceit lies in a scale model of the manor. As the player explores, new parts are located and can be added, causing rooms to appear in the ‚Äòreal‚Äô manor.

[h1] Pros:	[/h1].
1.Nice atmosphere and soundtrack
2.jump scares are good.
3.achievements are relatively easy to get.

[h1] Cons:	[/h1]
1.Story is virtually non existent.
2.optimisation is poor.

This is one of the games where there is a genuine horror feelings.story is small so nothing gets repeatative.got the game for free so can't complaint about it.overall had a nice experience with it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027267313', 'num_games_owned': 1838, 'num_reviews': 4460, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1526647357}
review:
Tags: 1PHWS - First P. Horror Walk Sim
Additional Tags: Delete Local Content & Remove from Library

TLDR: Typical manor exploration game. Scripted events. Jumpscares. Locked doors to funnel progression. Play once and discard. Unmemorable.

Game is well structured and the interactive map that reshapes the manor is a nice touch. Good audiovisuals.

The hard mode can be a bit tricky and is probably best enjoyed by those who've already beaten then game. I liked the immersion factor of cranking the flashlight but the amount of damage you take from the wood puppets as you try to figure out what to do next gets tedious fast.

I found the game to be at least on par with something from the Amnesia series. Perhaps a tad better even due to its stronger structure. However the game does not have that much content and has probably limited replay value so it is debatable just how valuable it is to hold unto permanent library. Still not a bad entry in this indie subgenre usually flooded with extreme mediocrity.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032077057', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 54, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1522094072}
review:
Kraven Manor is an easy review. What is it? It's a short, first person horror puzzle game. If you're the kind of person that likes first person, atmospheric experiences (especially horror ones), obviously you'll like this. There isn't much meat to the game and the puzzles are quite easy, but the horror aspect is done really well. While there are some minor jumpscares, the game relies more on tension of the unknown just as Amnesia does. The enemy that you face in this game only moves when you're not looking. Trying to solve puzzles and yet stay vigilant about what's chasing you adds an excellent element of horror. 

So is it worth the current price of $6? Maybe. I don't remember whether I got the game on sale or not, but I'd probably pay the $6. It took me 54 minutes to complete and to some that may not be worth it. To me though, a quick $6 was worth an hour of decent entertainment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198354092184', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1520991105}
review:
30 minutes into the game.
Complete the library sequence.
Travel through a doorway.
Fall through the floor.
Think "this must be a feature".
It wasn't a feature.
Complete the library sequence again.
Travel through the same doorway.
Fall through the same floor.


Not today Satan.

review:
I love horror games, and this one didnt disappoint.
Super short but packs a quite a nice punch, a bit glitchy at times (mainly bad timming of my part when picking stuff) but doesnt really take out from the experience.
Great eerie atmosphere and sound designs, easy puzzles but have a great potential of replay value.

author: {'steamid': '76561198167940370', 'num_games_owned': 1417, 'num_reviews': 700, 'playtime_forever': 330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1513439365}
review: This game really pulls you into a dark and rich setting that successfully sends chills up your spine. It's a short and yet intense walk through some of your darker nightmares about being lost in an abandoned mansion. I personally loved the library scene, and the statue dudes creep you out.In short, it's a single player game that is an enjoyable single evening of fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035359427', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1450056502}
review:
In short? A nice indie horror game with good scares.

In long? Really nice example of an indie horror game done right. The puzzle/room mechanic I thought was really cool. The end of the game really throws players a curve ball with the whole topsy turvy thing (no spoilers). Very visually appealing.

If you are looking for a short horror game with good aesthitics and genuine scares. Then I recommned this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003019731', 'num_games_owned': 1879, 'num_reviews': 368, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1509388596}
review:
N√£o me lembrava mais como Kraven Manor veio parar na minha Biblioteca, mas agora sei como ir√° voltar para l√°: com m√£os tr√™mulas.

O jogo nasceu de um projeto estudantil que criou vulto e volume atrav√©s do YouTube, ao ponto de seus idealizadores fundarem um est√∫dio, ampliarem o projeto inicial e lan√ßarem o jogo comercialmente. Para um t√≠tulo de estreia de desenvolvedores sem experi√™ncia, Kraven Manor √© uma experi√™ncia surpreendentemente bem polida, uma declara√ß√£o de amor ao horror g√≥tico e a sua arquitetura, aqui desempenhando um papel crucial para a jogabilidade.

Em termos de enredo, o jogo √© direto: voc√™ est√° no interior da mans√£o abandonada que d√° nome √† obra e precisa explorar seus segredos e sobreviver a seus desafios. N√£o h√° uma introdu√ß√£o, n√£o h√° constru√ß√£o de personagem. Voc√™ tanto pode ser um herdeiro em busca de respostas sobre seus antepassados ou um simples desafortunado que furou o pneu do carro do lado de fora e entrou para dar um telefonema. Talvez haja um texto de abertura que explique isso, mas os detalhes me fogem completamente diante da noite de tormento passada ali.

L√° fora, rel√¢mpagos rasgam um c√©u que voc√™ nunca v√™ atrav√©s de janelas fechadas ou imundas. Aqui dentro, a subvers√£o total do que voc√™ entende por "n√≠veis". Os aposentos da casa se alteram segundo uma mec√¢nica especial que voc√™ manipula e encontrar a combina√ß√£o correta √© fundamental para prosseguir. Enquanto isso, atrav√©s de fragmentos como bilhetes, quadros e livros, voc√™ tamb√©m vai combinando pouco a pouco a macabra hist√≥ria de William Kraven e sua fam√≠lia.


N√£o h√° combate, mas isso n√£o significa que seu personagem n√£o corra perigo de vida. Uma... entidade com uma particularidade mec√¢nica muito interessante ir√° persegui-lo, atormentando na maioria das vezes como um sinistro jogo de gato e rato, mas tamb√©m sendo agressiva e at√© mort√≠fera em outras.

O jogo n√£o √© dif√≠cil, muito pelo contr√°rio, seus enigmas s√£o f√°ceis de resolver e a equipe de desenvolvedores se preocupou em fornecer muitas dicas para voc√™ n√£o se perder no que precisa ser feito. Mas Kraven Manor tamb√©m n√£o √© tranquilo: em menos de duas horas de jogabilidade, morri tr√™s vezes, em todas elas por falhar em manter o sangue-frio.

A sequ√™ncia final √© de tirar o f√¥lego, uma fuga inesperada, o √°pice da insanidade e os estudantes conseguem logo depois dar uma li√ß√£o de como se fazer um confronto desesperador, mas n√£o imposs√≠vel de se triunfar. Pena que √© sucedido por um ep√≠logo previs√≠vel.

Originalmente publicado em: [url=http://blog.retinadesgastada.com.br/2017/11/jogando-kraven-manor.html]http://blog.retinadesgastada.com.br/2017/11/jogando-kraven-manor.html[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198043335731', 'num_games_owned': 525, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 338, 'last_played': 1506059828}
review:
This game would have been passable to me if it weren't for the frequent crashes. One of them forced me to start the game completely over. I went to the community to find a solution only to find other complaints about fatal crashes that were never answered. 

Also the puzzles weren't very well done. There were dumbwaiters, for instance, that I never had to use. I'm Not sure what they were for.There was a puzzle with paintings and globes that I never had to finish either. I couldn't find a second globe. I thought if I explored further I would either find it or get stuck, but neither happened and I'm not sure why the puzzle was there.

I also didn't like that there was  no actual reading of documents. If you find a document or a book, you can't pick it up, the game just gives you a one line summary of what was in it, or a quote from it. I found that disappointing and detracted from the immersion feeling, and made it feel like the game was a rush job, just thrown together; in a word, lazy. 

Maybe it is bacause I am a longtime point and click adventure fan that I expected more. Still, this was my first experience with a horror escape kind of genre and it did leave me curious to explore the genre further.

review: Kraven Manor is a fun, short horror game. The graphics are dated, but functional. The ambiance of the game is well done. There are some tense moments. There puzzles are just ok. The main antagonist is a Slender Man looking wood sculpture that chases you around, usually when you're not looking at him. It took less than two hours to finish. I recommend it for some cheap quick, horror fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042571202', 'num_games_owned': 1138, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1475430314}
review:
This was... a strange little game to say the least. I don't really know if I want to recommend it or not.

Honestly, it's fairly unique in both its art style and story. I wouldn't really call it much of a 'horror' game so much as an atmospheric game. It's got the same principle as those "Don't turn your back on the monster or he'll get you" games. However, I did enjoy the room moving mechanic and how you could link different rooms together to get to hidden and secret areas.

The game is very linear and feels kind of bare and unfinished. There's not much to do or to explore. There is no threat of a monster or penalty for dying. It just feels kind of... meh. It's got achievements and a low price, so you decide if it's worth it or not.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007747398', 'num_games_owned': 937, 'num_reviews': 128, 'playtime_forever': 147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 147, 'last_played': 1497713396}
review:
A fairly short game, with beautiful graphics and nice sound tracks. It successfully delivers a creepy atmosphere and some jumpscares. The puzzel solving is also decent. Feels like a simpler version of Amnesia the dark descend combined with Cry of Fear. Hard to believe that this beautiful piece of work was delivered by a bunch of students. 
Bravo, devs ! 

7.5/10

review: Creepy little first=person horror game. You explore a puzzling mansion in first-person view. There is no combat in this game so running away is the way forward. Shades of the Doctor Who story, "Blink".  It's relatively short but definitely compelling for the entire run and doesn't feel like the experience has been padded out. The puzzles are never frustrating without being too obvious. I enjoyed my time playing through the experience and the story was an interesting one that I hadn't seen before.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014940729', 'num_games_owned': 509, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 379, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 182, 'last_played': 1505077011}
review:
Great little horror game. 

- Starts off scary but gets less and less scary as the game goes on.

- Can be beat in 15 minutes if you know what you're doing but is about 2 hours long otherwise.

- Has puzzles. 

- Does not run very well and may crash when loading saved games after death.

- Has twist ending if you do obscure things. Likely you'll not do them in your first run so there's replay value in trying to get the other ending.

- You can cheat at getting the 'never hit by an enemy' achievement by loading from checkpoints if you get hit.

- Don't try to reattached the leaver from where it came from because it can fall out of the world. It's easy to get stuck at this part since the door forward locks. Bring the leaver back to the wall-box thing.

- There's 2 difficulties: normal and nightmare. Just skip normal because the only differences is normal gives you an unlimited-battery flashlight. You only need the flashlight in monster areas and they're far apart and short. Plus there's an achievement related to beating the game on nightmare.

- The game tells its story mostly with blurbs of text on screen given by clicking on books and papers on the ground. It's 'meh.' There's just background info and vague info about back stuff that happened in the past before the game like basically every horror game.

Over-all I'd recommend this game. If it's on sale and you think you might like it: buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025370485', 'num_games_owned': 1651, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1492189232}
review: Out of all the crappy, cheap, and short first person horror games on Steam this is probably one of the better ones. Unlike some of the others this was clearly made by people with some talent since it's not total garbage. Still it doesn't even come close to a proper horror game like Amnesia The Dark Descent, which it seems to take a lot of inspiration from. It's got some original ideas but it's mostly Amnesia with a slender-like monster. Story is very light and a bit ridiculus. Takes about an hour to beat. If that sounds ok to you it might be worth getting in a sale, otherwise don't bother. It's nothing special or memorable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012111055', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 249, 'playtime_forever': 93, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1488406913}
review:
Lo recomiendo pero con la boca peque√±a, porque aunque para m√≠ el juego se redime por sus ideas debo reconocer la ejecuci√≥n es bastante pobre. 

Este juego tiene ideas muy buenas que con una mejor direcci√≥n del conjunto podr√≠a haber conseguido un indie de calidad. Por desgracia ha quedado en un aprobado raspado. Muy raspado, de esos de llorarle al profesor. De hecho en los 20 primeros minutos estuve a punto de dejarlo, pero luego me dio pena y lo acab√©. 

Y me alegro de haberlo hecho porque precisamente los 15 √∫ltimos minutos es donde la cosa coge m√°s color, la cosa toma ritmo y el final... bueno, el final me pareci√≥ un buen gui√±o a las pelis cl√°sicas de terror.

El juego consiste en ir avanzando por salas recogiendo maquetas que encajas en el sal√≥n principal y te abren otras salas. La idea es montar todo el mapa de la casa mediante las maquetas y la gracia consiste en que cuando pones una maqueta de habitaci√≥n encajada en una puerta esa habitaci√≥n aparece en la casa. Es decir: la casa es un puzzle en si misma. Es una gran idea.

Luego est√°n los enemigos: son unas estatuas de bronce que s√≥lo se mueven cuando no miras para ellas. As√≠ que cuando te las encuentras la paranoia es andar de espaldas, ilumin√°ndolas con tu linterna, porque si giras la cabeza se te echan encima. Algo as√≠ como el escondite ingl√©s pero te arrancan la cabeza si pierdes. Otra gran idea. 

Los decorados no est√°n mal y la m√∫sica me ha parecido muy destacable. No es para echar bombas pero es un indie barato, no juega en grandes ligas. 

El problema est√° en que esas dos ideas geniales, la de la casa/puzzle y la de las estatuas que se mueven cuando t√∫ miras para otro lado, est√°n en medio de un dise√±o de juego que no invita a divertirse. Te mueves andando o corriendo, pero no puedes saltar. Interaccionas lo justo con los objetos. Todo se nota acartonado, muy de los 90, pierdes cualquier calidad de inmersi√≥n. 

Y aunque hay una historia por detr√°s est√° muy mal contada. Las descripciones de las fotos (que no las ves, te las describen) y los textos son tan cortos que parecen telegramas. Es como si al que desarroll√≥ el gui√≥n le diese pereza extenderse. ¬øPor qu√© est√°s en la casa? ¬øY por qu√© no puedes salir? Los primeros diez minutos paseaba por all√≠ sin enterarme de nada y sin sentirme parte de ninguna historia. Parec√≠a una demo de un motor gr√°fico. S√≥lo un poco m√°s de esfuerzo en encajar la historia, en darte un hilo narrativo, ya habr√≠a hecho mucho por el juego.

Tambi√©n habr√≠a que mejorar mucho m√°s los puzzles. No es que sean f√°ciles, es que son b√°sicos, dir√≠a que casi infantiles. El rompecabezas de 'uno dice la verdad y todos mienten', un tonel al que hay que meter cosas para que tire de una polea, unas palancas de manual de pr√°cticas. Porque de hecho en gran parte del juego tuve esa sensaci√≥n: de estar jugando a algo hecho en unas pr√°cticas de escuela de videojuegos.

Tambi√©n es corto: una hora y media. Por m√≠ cojonudo porque dada la calidad final me parece tiempo suficiente que dedicarle, pero para los que cuentan los euros por minuto este juego es carne de bundle.

Le he metido mucha ca√±a y a√∫n as√≠ lo recomiendo. Pues s√≠. Porque hay un rato en el tramo final donde el juego apunta maneras y se escapa del acartonamiento. Adem√°s el final con homenaje a las pelis de terror de serie B me ha conquistado, soy muy facil√≥n. Pero sobre todo lo recomiento porque creo que, pese a su pobre ejecuci√≥n, tiene buenas ideas. Es un juego donde se ve una buena intenci√≥n fallida por culpa de una direcci√≥n sin ambici√≥n alguna, de 'andar por casa'.

review: Very short horror adventure type of game.  The graphics look pretty good and the atmosphere in the game is really well done.  Only buy this in a cheap bundle even though it is worth playing. For me the game was exactly what I was looking for.  A short game that I didn't want to invest much time in but still have fun playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198262251865', 'num_games_owned': 462, 'num_reviews': 350, 'playtime_forever': 210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 210, 'last_played': 1485316335}
review:
I play a lot of horror games for my channel. Lots of really bad ones. Not too many good ones, sadly. This one was pretty good. The story was decent, but the gameplay was the focus, which was entertaining and varied with each new task. The price point is perfect--6$ is just right. The game is maybe an hour 1/2 long (I played through it a couple times checking for new stuff) but for the price that seems fair because it is made well and resolves itself well at the end. Overall, very satisfying.

Thanks, developer! Cheers and keep making games!
(and watch Lumps Plays on youtube! Go do it! 100% visual commentary!)

author: {'steamid': '76561197989290281', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 315, 'playtime_forever': 303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 303, 'last_played': 1476219992}
review:
https://youtu.be/prNUXZRN010

A refreshing change - an indie horror game that actually lives up to the name. Graphically its well done, the environments are great and the mechanic of changing the layout of the house via models of the room is well implemented. Controls are smooth and the game has two different endings. It is also quite challenging on the harder difficulty setting. 

The only real sticking point is the length of the game - you can easily beat it in less than an hour once you know what to do. Still the game is cheap, and the different endings do add to the game time so worthy of adding to your wishlist for sure. 

Hopefully the devs will work on a kraven manor 2 that expands upon the solid groundwork this game provides.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994895629', 'num_games_owned': 401, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 130, 'last_played': 1484842870}
review: This is a really nice puzzle horror game that will make you jump and maybe scream like a little girl. Now the story line is mostly in text so be ready to read a lot if you want to understand what the heck is going on and the its a bit short. Though even with these faults it still has pretty cool puzzle mechanics (though some of the puzzles are super easy) that are fun to solve.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009334801', 'num_games_owned': 996, 'num_reviews': 249, 'playtime_forever': 190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 190, 'last_played': 1481313004}
review:
Ennesimo titolo sulla falsariga di Amnesia sviluppato da una manciata di studenti universitari, anche qui dovremo andare in giro armati solo di torcia in una tetra magione per scoprire cos'√® successo.
L'aspetto pi√π interessante del gioco √® senz'altro la manipolazione delle stanze tramite un modellino nell'atrio, infatti sbloccandole man mano potremo disporle come vogliamo e accedervi di conseguenza da una o l'altra porta. Quest'idea di personalizzarci la casa non si vede spesso nei videogiochi, ma nonostante la bella pensata rimane comunque molto limitata e rende il posizionamento un po' fine a s√© stesso (c'√® giusto un enigma -facoltativo- a riguardo, per dire).

Essendo un titolo horror, non pu√≤ mancare la componente jumpscare, qui sotto forma di inquietanti esseri che ci inseguono quando voltiamo loro le spalle e si fermano quando gli puntiamo la torcia in faccia. Alcune parti sono un po' sleali e difficili da passare indenni, ma non √® un grande problema, la salute si rigenera da sola e anche se si viene catturati e si muore, c'√® sempre un comodo checkpoint pochi istanti prima. Queste sequenze sono comunque scriptate, perci√≤ una volta superate √® possibile ritornare a piacere nelle stanze in un secondo momento per esplorarle meglio senza timore di essere sorpresi da qualcuno. 

La durata √® senz'altro il difetto maggiore del gioco: anche prendendosela comoda e leggendo tutto il leggibile si riesce a finire in un'oretta scarsa, molto meno le volte seguenti visto che si sa gi√† cosa fare, dove andare e come risolvere gli enigmi (pochi, ma alcuni molto carini). 
Ad aumentare un po' la longevit√† c'√® una modalit√† Incubo che √® tipo identica ma con una torcia che si scarica, e un finale alternativo da sbloccare raccogliendo un paio di oggetti ben nascosti nelle varie stanze. Finali che sono in linea con lo spirito del gioco e, per quanto riguarda quello alternativo, getta una nuova luce su tutta la vicenda. Nonostante le poche righe a descriverla e l'evidente amatorialit√† del tutto, infatti, la trama nel complesso l'ho trovata ben pensata e con discreto potenziale, ma purtroppo essendo come detto un progetto universitario, questa √® e questa rimane.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969875942', 'num_games_owned': 311, 'num_reviews': 120, 'playtime_forever': 116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1478875672}
review:
It has a few mild scares when the mannequins creep up on you when you're not looking, but it's mainly a puzzle game/walking sim. I expected a really short game, it is short but it took me longer than I expect to complete, but it glitched out a few times (it's in the vid) and got stuck too. 
It has a cool atmosphere at it is definitely worth your time.
Kraven Manor, my first impression and as it happens also full playthrough (SPOILER alert!) 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=w3AhIw-ZL88
6:04 Walking through the spider webs, first encounter with mannequin.
11:48 Lights out, first death by one of the statues. 
24:52 Library Jumpscare!
28:08 Jumpscare!
33:45 Stumbling on a logical puzzle of a globe, globe frames, and portraits of a woman.
47:23 RUN!
51:55 Game glitched out, this one doesn't want to be captured it seems. I broke the game.
57:14 The Ending.
