author: {'steamid': '76561198080164476', 'num_games_owned': 69, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1579921687}
review: This game is well worth a play. I really enjoyed the games sounds, graphics, and plot. It was quite a fun adventure, and for a Halloween sale of a dollar, it's definitely worth picking up and playing through. Keep in mind that it's a 1 - 2 playthrough game, and'll only last about an hour for the first playthrough. If you're into Achievements though, you'll probably play through this a few times. Anyhow, pick it up for a dollar while sales last and give it a go, you won't regret it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029648113', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 140, 'last_played': 1475737961}
review:
I couldn't believe it when I found out this game was originally a student project. It blew my mind. The game was so good I figured it must have been a passion project of a small group of career developers. While it has some technical issues, at least on my set up, the game was a very fun experience. I recommend it highly. Fun game, nice story, good ending, it's all there. I go a little more in depth on some one the things I really liked in my video. But long story short this game shows great promise from up and coming talents in the industry and I'm excited to see where life takes them. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EkCMhk93HzU

author: {'steamid': '76561197990139151', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1470734514}
review:
This is a fun little horror game, but it is SHORT. It feels like one section of a much bigger game, and I finished it in one hour.  At first this game feels like it wants to be Amnesia, and I wouldn't be surprised if it was originally a custom story.  Not all that scary, but enjoyable enough to keep you interested long enough to see it through til the end. 

Not bad for 6 bucks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198102263220', 'num_games_owned': 570, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1468168950}
review:
[h1]Short horror game with some annoying bugs[/h1]

This will be a short review because I don¬¥t have so much time. First off, this game is good, but not worth the (now) 6 euros. Really, the dev team made a right step to lower the price a bit, but even 5‚Ç¨ were too much, because you can beat the game in less than 30 minutes, if you¬¥re good in horror games. But not the lengthen but the quality of the game is the crucial factor being responsible for my negative review.

I really liked the idea behind the game. OK, that a random guy who¬¥s in the "I-need-to-get-answers"-mood is stepping through a haunted house is nothing enterily new for a horror game, but the house¬¥s ability (or manor) itself non-mainstream: By finding different little model parts of the manor¬¥s rooms you¬¥re able to explore more of it. 
Overall I think the ideas that the guys had are really cool: If you look around you can find books and documents which tell you a bit more about the history of the Kraven family and maybe you¬¥ll find out what could happen to you if you make the wrong desicion(s). I can understand why lots of people like the game and give it a positive review.

But there¬¥s no "middle-rate"-finger and that¬¥s why I have to give, like it or not, a negative review. I fully understand that after a game comes out, you¬¥re not so ambitious as a dev to debug the game you made during a long period of time. But after 2 years, even a game costing 6 bugs does not to have such kind of bugs: 

- Picking up items is tricky, sometimes not possible (>Restart)
- Moving backwards through doors is nearly impossible, don¬¥t ask me why (Nightmare Mode ahoy!)
- Some scenes just don¬¥t trigger if you don¬¥t do exactly that what the game is awating (which is annoying because you HAVE those options to move around and that had made the game better. Let me explain: The game wants you to go from A to B. But you have the possiblities to go from A to B, C and D. From C you can go to B. So you think "If I choose A > C > B", the scene will trigger. No, it won¬¥t. (>Restart)).

Even worse, the game (my PC is pretty good) crashes every 20 minutes. Luckily I know the game by heart, that¬¥s why I can complete it within 15 minutes... (For achievements e.g.).

I really don¬¥t like giving negative reviews, but the game will (probably) keep it¬¥s "90% free of bugs" state. That¬¥s why: [b]Please, don¬¥t waste 6 euros on a dead game. If you want to support the devs, allright, but if you¬¥re looking for a cool and quick horror game, do yourself a favor and get it on sale or (even better) in a bundle.[/b]

Thanks for reading and have a nice one,

[i]Mike
a.k.a. BlackBurningHaze[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198066726529', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 474, 'last_played': 1466104925}
review:
As a game, I don't think it really works.  If you're looking for terror, this game is a great thriller though... but that's it.  In the gaming category it isn't so great.  If that's what you're aiming for, look around a little harder (first-person puzzle/adventure and drama/terror game - you wont find that here, sorry).

Why is it that I don't like it?  Please read...

Well, so it begins... you're dumped somehow in an old manor without any clue as to how you fell in such predicament.  It's almost like you woke up from a bad dream and there you are.  With that, you are left with a flashlight (awesome, and if you choose the hard-game option it may not even work), and you've somehow forgotten how to touch, grab, look, observe, hit, examine, etc. anything that isn't pertaining to your game's progress... no "biggie".  As you explore you find that you're ALL alone.... or are you?  Nope... and this is a spoiler (so don't read further if you don't want to know this) you find something that may "possibly" be alive... a mannequin.. not just any mannequin, but one made out of copper (what the heck?!... copper for real?).  I haven't yet been to the attic, but I already know what the subject of the game might be.... the murderer, the keeper of the manor has been manifesting itself in that mannequin (don't know for sure yet but clues do suggest that).  As you move on, you will probably decipher the fact that guests in the manor were pretty much killed by the keeper at some point.

Be careful with most of this game's reviews.... they DID lead me to take the mannequin lightly.  Don't let it happen to you, the mannequin is VERY MUCH lethal.

Whew, I took that out of my chest!  Well, the biggest issue I had was the fact that the mannequin is indeed lethal, but there are mechanics that just didn't seem to agree with me.  Having played games like Zork, Montague's Mount, Riven, etc (and loved them) you do assume the mechanics will be similar.  I have to blame myself... I hate spoilers so I didn't look for sample videos (I should've).... anyway, there is no inventory, basically as you would in real life you carry things in front of you, BUT this is what is not very real-life-like... remember the above mentioned? (look, observe, hit, etc) you will soon realize that you are DEFENSELESS in every possible which way.... except for room models, I don't think you can actually carry anything else... a key perhaps, but not much else.  That means that if you're attacked in a dark room, you can't swing... despite the fact that the bedroom and library are full of books (and that books have been amazing murder weapons in the past) you can't simply grab one of the damn things and swing them at the dreaded mannequin.

There is no "real" save game feature (I hate that in games).... ok... that's not a big problem for certain games, you complete certain puzzles and there; they save.... NOT this one.  This game sometimes saves RIGHT when you're about to enter a room and sometimes, not even.  That's a problem when you're done getting a model and just want to put the game down.  Such is the case with the bedroom, I am not happy I have to do that sequence again!  It should save everytime you place a model on the main counter.  Why doesn't it do that?!!!

Anyway, it appears you can't really swing that model at the mannequin's face either (if you needed to).... I imagine myself in this game as a disabled person with a mechanical (crane, hand or device) to carry things with... pretty much.

I am not done, and quite frankly, I am unsure whether I want to play this game again :( The issue is not the fact that is scary (not the biggest problem), but when things are scary and you're somehow stupid or disabled, that's just not nice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103597406', 'num_games_owned': 163, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1460537556}
review:
Really cool atmosphere and concept! The story makes you feel like there is a deep rooted history of Kraven and all the things that has went on in this house. Just walking around you dread the sound of something sneaking up on you which makes the jump scares more intense. I definitely recommend this to anyone that wants to experience a great horror game, play with the lights off!

author: {'steamid': '76561198009844262', 'num_games_owned': 262, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1458441256}
review:
Este juego lo consegu√≠ cuando lo regalaban... Si est√°s en la misma situaci√≥n juegalo, pero si has de pagar yo mirar√≠a para otro lado...


+Te va a dejar taquicardico alguna vez que otra!
+No dejes de mirarlo! No apartes la vista de √©l!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198160341292', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1576607006}
review:
Let's put it like this: If you expect an open world or huge map game, then this game isn't really for you. Kraven manor takes a lot of time and nerves for the beginner but if you played it two - three times, you will manage it in under an hour.
The graphics are extremely good (the game from a pile of students so they did a good job) and the audio is nice. Let me give you a tip: If your flashlight runs out of power, remember a circular route, switch it of to reload and run in circles until the flashlight has recharged. Because when mr. Brass is on your a*se and your out of power, then standing is rewarded with a blood shower.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136235875', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 181, 'last_played': 1458054013}
review: Short but good game! Scary and surprisingly elegant. Worth a try!

author: {'steamid': '76561197997728939', 'num_games_owned': 910, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1457723212}
review:
A really novel central mechanic overshadowed by cut-and-paste 'horror' statues who move when you don't look at them. Marred down by a finnicky flashlight, what could be an extremely engaging and intelligent puzzle solving spooky adventure about a shifting mansion becomes a relatively boring rehash of the same horror enemies the indie scene has been obsessed with for the last 3 years. Although the shifting rooms of this game are an excellent concept that is very engaging, it's completely overshadowed by its lackluster writing and uninspired enemy.

In short, an excellent concept completely ruined by an overshadowing cookie-cutter enemy which bogs the game down into a frustrating exercise of patience. A shame.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997615828', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 169, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1457280267}
review: Kraven Manor √® ambientato all'interno di una villa. Inviati per indagini su alcune sparizioni avvenute nella zona ci ritroveremo a vagare dentro queste mura che hanno dell'incredibile. Poco dopo si manifesteranno le prime apparizioni come si addice a questo genere di giochi. E noi dovremo scappare, perch√© chiaramente non avremo n√© armi (nemmeno un bastone) n√© il buio ci potr√† proteggere garantendoci un nascondiglio sicuro. L'unica cosa che terremo stretta a noi sar√† la torcia che nella modalit√† "Nightmare" avr√† tempi di ricarica maggiori e si spegner√† spesso nel momento del bisogno. Scoprire i segreti del maniero √® stato bello e coinvolgente. Enigmi facili ed esplorazione mai noisa. Peccato per i pochi libri o scritti sparsi in giro che aggiungono poco al background della storia e si poteva sicuramente fare di meglio. Un buon sonoro e musiche mai troppo invasive completano questo piccolo indie, che ricordo √® stato fatto da 13 ragazzi universitari con budget bassissimo. Basta poco a volte per intrattenere piacevolmente un'ora. Loro ci sono riusciti ed il prezzo quando in sconto √® imbarazzante. Pollice su per gli amanti del genere...

author: {'steamid': '76561197998674000', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1538720488}
review: 12 min in the game and dead already there is really no way to do any thing in the game other then picking up silly stuff that does nothing like wine bottles and glasses, globes ect but yet the game will tell to throw them and all it will do is drop at your feet. Items can not be set placed or any thing else that I see, yes you get a key to unlock a lock but if that is the extent of the interaction then I just don't know how to contain my bordom. Glad I got the game for only a buck so no money lost just a piece of gum....lol Graphics look great game play and interaction suck, For me the game is already over only after 12 mins due to bordom and the fact that a thing keeps killing me and I am trapped in a hall way with no where to go and nothing to interact with, the game wants you to run down the hallway O by the way it will tell you that to run you need to hit left shift to do this and guess what you still can run, what a game, controls are crap and interaction is very poor. So if you are looking for 12 min of bordom then this is the game for you!!!!!!!!!!! Enjoy and try not to get to bord

author: {'steamid': '76561197981664510', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 202, 'last_played': 1456266300}
review:
Kraven Manor hat (wie ich finde) definitiv was von "Amnesia: The Dark Descent..."
Die Atmosphere ist √§hnlich und das Spiel im Allgemeinen sieht √§hnlich aus. Wenn man auf Horrorspiele steht und hier und da mal "kombinieren" mag, der kommt an einem kauf von Kraven Manor definitiv nicht vorbei.

+D√ºstere Atmosphere 
+Sch√∂ne Grafik
+Gute Puzzles
+Interessante Geschichte
+Sch√∂n gemachte Schockmomente
+Zwei verschiedene Endungen (im Playthrough)

Was ist mir Negativ aufgefallen? 
-Ich habe hier und da ein paar Bugs entdeckt (im Playthrough)
-Verglichen mit Amnesia & co. ist es relativ kurz.

Das zweite Ende hat es in sich... Man muss sehr lange √ºberlegen, wie man an die gebrauchten Sachen kommt.
F√ºr ein Playthrough sowie beide Enden (2. Ende mit Erkl√§rung): https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=A7f6C9T5_Do&list=PLMWxnx2x1nMWT7zCen-Lafo5wyAm16OiY

Danke f√ºrs lesen :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198037920209', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1206, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1661341841}
review:
[h1]What you can see can't kill you.[/h1]
[b]Kraven Manor[/b] is a short but scary journey. Like many survival horror games you can expect to find supernatural references, violence, and blood.  If you're looking for a decent scare, it won't disappoint you. Also your way of looking at mannequins will definitely change.

[list]PROS:
[*]Monster encounters are unlike those in most horror games 
[*]Creepy atmosphere nails the tone 
[*]Intriguing room-placing mechanic

CONS:
[*]Way too short
[*]Room placing mechanic is ultimately squandered 
[*]Puzzles are too simple 
[*]Barely existing plot which doesn't make much sense.[/list]

author: {'steamid': '76561198106634958', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1454265409}
review:
The game last about 70-90 minutes. It's not bad, but surely I woulfn't call it the best horror as many do.
In fact, there is so little horror in it, it wouldn't scare even my 3 years old cousin.
The story is one we have seen 1000 times in this kind of games, while the game play is basicaly move around and use your flashlight against a manequine until you have escaped. (it could also be the new title, "manequine escape")
If you find it as I did for some cents or free, it's not too bad for spending time, otherwise I wouldn't suggest it.

review:
Voto: 6,5/10

Giochino discreto, ma non mi ha pienamente convinto.
Fortunatamente l'ho preso in giveaway, vedendolo dalla pagina dello store mi ha intrigato, e ho deciso di giocarci.
A parte il fatto che √® cortissimo (finito in poco pi√π di un'ora), la grafica non √® eccelsa, l'illuminazione pure, e la rigiocabilit√† inesistente.
Carina l'idea dei nemici, specie di manichini che, se illuminati dalla nostra torcia, rimangono immobili, ma appena persi di vista vi "corrono" incontro (in realt√† non corrono, traslano nello spazio fino a voi -.- ) e la trama √® discreta (nel senso che almeno ce n'√® una parvenza), sempre parlando di un gioco da un'ora e mezza.
In conclusione ve lo consiglio solo in giveaway o a pochi centesimi
PS: becca qualche punto in pi√π della sufficienza solo perch√® √® stato sviluppato da un gruppo di ragazzi del college, se non ho capito male.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035403576', 'num_games_owned': 1945, 'num_reviews': 218, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1519633825}
review:
Good ambiance, but there are too many occasions where you can die.
I understand that it's supposed to scare the player, but having them too many times, with often no idea what you're supposed to do/where you're supposed to go just results in tedious replays of these boring scenes.
Since you cannot look at your environment and understand what you must do (the "killer" moving when you turn your back to it), if you didn't find the clickable spot at first, you're screwed.
And don't even think of trying to keep "it" in sight while looking at the environment, your flashlight often turns off by itself and "it" comes to you to kill you. Again. Not funny.
And to add to that, there are only savepoints, forcing you to redo what you did just because you died earlier just to have another try.

I know some people may not mind, but I do.
This is not what I call a game "fun to play".
You can scare me, but you can't force me to do and redo what I did because I didn't click on your secret spot.

Interesting idea, poor execution. You should not give your players Frustration. Ever.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995820083', 'num_games_owned': 1833, 'num_reviews': 584, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1451896734}
review: Kraven Manor is a short horror game set in a mansion that starts out as a single entrance hall, and grows outwards as you build the layout using a small-scale model in the hall from pieces that you find by exploring. It's an interesting concept, but it's short-lived, both because the game itself is pretty short and because of the fact that unless you go for the somewhat underwhelming secret ending, the game never really uses the feature in any puzzley sort of way except for one point where you're tasked with connecting rooms in a straight line to access one on the end of the board. The core gameplay is based around solving small puzzles in each room, usually while under attack by the game's enemy, a mannequin that you can probably already imagine if you've played Condemned, or any number of the other games that copied the "mannequin that follows you when you turn around" feature. For something made by a group of college students it's a pretty decent horror game, and it's certainly better than all those $20 Slender clones that weren't even worth making, but it is still a bit of a steep sell for $6, given that it ends so abruptly that you're mostly just left with disappointment that they thought up such a novel mechanic and did mostly nothing with it. Kraven Manor is the sort of game that you throw into your cart as a bonus after adding all the games you wanted to buy in a sale because going from $30 to $33 isn't that big of a jump, but I wouldn't necessarily call it the game that you go out and buy on its own.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055634739', 'num_games_owned': 925, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1451864775}
review:
Amnesia's younger brother, Kraven Manor has a lot to learn but can be very enjoyable. Despite it's very short length, the ideas in this game could have gone way further. The whole concept of moving the rooms where you want to with a maquete is unique and awesome, which also could had been explored to a bigger depth like finding secret rooms with certain arrangements of rooms, just an idea.

Some parts of the sountrack were definitely helping the atmosphere of the game, and a pretty good atmosphere it is.  Sadly, there's only one enemy, so there could had been more enemies too. Honestly, this enemy becomes boring as you progress through the game. 

Nightmare mode is where the fun's at really. Kraven Manor becomes too easy on Regular. Nightmare gives you a rechargable flashlight that can only be turned on for about 30 seconds, after that it needs to be recharged which takes about 10 seconds. While making a little difference, it makes the game way more fun and panic inducing, as running out of batteries in a dark section can be your certain death. Regarding jump scares, these are scarce and a bit predictable.

Graphically, I was impressed! It looks stunning and you'll definitely love it if you're a fan of the art design of the Amnesia games, it catches the Amnesia vibe perfectly. Sad that this was only developed with a 32 bit version, as I've encountered some "Ran out of memory" crashes about 3 times.

To finish my review, Kraven Manor is a worthy experience. The price is kind of high for the amount of content you get. It's really really short, and that saddens me. Best to get it on a bundle of some sort, like i did. Also, I find it very unprofessional to quote youtubers in reviews, it's something I have been noticing in the last few months and needs to be stopped.

6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198054198329', 'num_games_owned': 2584, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1451649055}
review:
There were a few moments that shined and in theory would have worked out great, but the execution was really off. Regardless of who made this and their experience, this is still a product that is asking for money.

For $5.99 the price is barely justified. Even though it is a little over an hour I could not bring myself to finish this. I typically enjoy short bite sized games perfect for killing a couple hours but between everything that was wrong with it I just had to put it down.

First of all the game runs bad. [i]Very[/i] bad. Graphics set to low and 0 FXAA, it struggled to stay above 24, rarely peaking at 40. This made it ridiculously janky and nigh impossible to stomach. I'll say that if it maintained a steady 60 frames a second on high (which should NOT be a problem for my specs) I would've enjoyed the setting and general look of the game alot better.

Gameplay-wise there isn't anything special. Walk around, solve "puzzles" (so minimal and straightforward they shouldn't be even called that), antagonist pop up at places/follow you/etc. This is how almost all horror games go, except that this doesn't work here all the time.

The bronze mannequin was definitely creepy at certain points and the way it behaved and interacted with you was well done. At certain points you would be stumbling around in the dark trying to keep your eyes on him (otherwise he can move and attack you). Playing on Nightmare, your flashlight runs out and darkness allows him movement. This was the strongest aspect of the game.

Other instances of interaction with the mannequin were sadly laughable and unavoidably comedic looking. At some point you walk into a sideroom in the bedroom and the door shuts behind you. You open a chest and see some pictures and then you hear a loud sound like the door opening. Turn around and the mannequin's leg is halfway in the room. It then "is dragged" out while dramatic music is playing. When you leave the room there is a shadow on the wall of the mannequin that "falls over" when you get close to it. There are many other times like this that unintentionally spark a chuckle, such as the time you spend in the wine cellar, the white medical ish room (the maze was another frustrating sequence that I gave up on when the game crashed), the attic, and the second visit to the library.

The last main point of contention would be the "examine-able" objects, like the notes, books, and pictures. Nearly all other horror games, regardless of being true independent titles or "indie" in the sense that Amnesia is indie, all have notes, books, and pictures being the main source of plot information. Typically when you interact with one you get to view the note, book, or picture, however in this, a tooltip simply pops up telling you the information. Other than this being a way of cutting corners I see no purpose for deviating from the working existent formula. What purpose does NOT showing you the paper serve? Especially with the photos. What were they thinking? Any potential impact of the story was completely wasted this way. Instead of seeing a crime scene photo you are told that this generic looking photo is that of a crime scene. This was not a budget, time, or experience issue, since many other games (even markedly WORSE ones) have the sense to not do this. This was pure laziness.

The music would be the strongest aspect of the game, but sadly this isn't saying much. I love me some dark ambient / borderline drone music but compared to what's in other games, albums, etc. either the score was either generically weak or it was terribly under-utilized. Droning sounds are not inherently creepy. If they are used well in conjunction with elements in the game such as what's going on, interactions, scenes, etc. it has the potential to be creepy, even terrifying. The quality of the music was not unique enough to hold up against it being under-utilized.

While there are some distinct positive aspects to this title, Kraven Manor severely underwhelms for the price. There are countless other games out there that have many things in common (even stuff that at first glance you'd assume to be worse than this) for $5.99 or less. I got it for free and was somewhat willing to look past the flaws but even then I came away disappointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970313625', 'num_games_owned': 1421, 'num_reviews': 485, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2, 'last_played': 1450573218}
review: Better than most indie horror trash but really short, about 45 minutes long.  I didn't do the extra secret room but I'd guess that adds on another 15 minutes or less.  Not really worth $6 so get it on sale or from K!ngu!n or gTWOa.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068102627', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 145, 'playtime_forever': 250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 250, 'last_played': 1449326584}
review:
Short but fun, with a good atmosphere.
Since im a slow player 4h got me a perfect game, while one playtrough took 45 min.
If you are a fan of quick horror games, get it at a reduced price or in a bundle.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973230221', 'num_games_owned': 14311, 'num_reviews': 849, 'playtime_forever': 120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1449078524}
review: Its a nice idea of a game, its a bit scary, it has its atmosphere but its so short, the many books, photos could use more of their potential. I like it and you should play it twice to see both endings, even if the 2nd is so strange and not really an end but take a look yourself. For a low budget product its fine but really there could be more. With all achievements i had 2 hours fun in my 2 runs, so i hope you enjoy it 1-2 hours a few too. I give it personally 77 %, test it if you like it, there could be so more rooms, so get it with a discount on steam and make your best out of it. Thanks for reading. P.S. i hope the developer still add "TRADING CARDS".

author: {'steamid': '76561198086995968', 'num_games_owned': 1410, 'num_reviews': 151, 'playtime_forever': 87, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1446997218}
review:
I spook really easy where horror games are concerned. This game did not disappoint. It had my heart in my mouth in a few places....... :D The controls are simple, and the graphics are good. The dark bits are really dark, but you have a good-quality flashlight to help with those areas.

This game is currently listed at ¬£4.79. This isn't too bad a price to pay for this game if you are looking for a bit of a scare. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198141231595', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1494604831}

author: {'steamid': '76561198254220295', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1673995974}
review: Absolutely terrifying! My feelings for this game is that of a love/hate relationship It's so good but so bad all at once! Especially for my heart... There's a few jump scares in there but honestly, the tension is probably the most frightening thing throughout most of the game. Whether you're unaware of what's next or already know what is to come, you still find your adrenaline pumping hella fast. There are two different endings which is also something I love in my games. If you're into horror with multiple endings and find dolls/mannequins creepy, this is a game definitely worth playing!

author: {'steamid': '76561197995382839', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 80, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1420585965}
review: Made by a team at my grad program. It's good, especially considering they developed it in like 6 months.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052247733', 'num_games_owned': 432, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1673907437}
review: This game is fantastic. It's fairly short, but the mechanics contained within that short time are very well-done and pretty unique. Scared the crap out of me multiple times and the puzzles are fairly intuitive, but still make you think a little, so it spares you some of the frustration many games of this type can cause you. Especially for the price, this is highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009943989', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 144, 'last_played': 1463950159}
review:
This is my review for Wes Kraven's Manor.

I got this game when I purchased the Humble Bundle so that I could get a copy of Stalker: Shadow of Chernobyl. I didn't really plan on playing any of the other games. However, Me and My Associate thought it would be a laugh to play Kravendales Manor. It looked like a Frictional game (The company that made Amnesia: The Dark Descent). 

I kind of feel deceiving for giving this a thumbs up. It was not the worst game I have ever played, however it did have a few low points. Some of the ideas were dank. The changeable room layout was a nice touch and gave you a lovely feeling of immersion. Plus, the graphics were pretty good for a cheap horror game. However the cheapness can be experienced in Kravat Manor.  The main antagonist "The Bronze Man" was poorly designed and shown way to many times for him to actually be scary, especially when his movement is shown to the player, which breaks all sense of fear as Talos' underdeveloped brother is slipping about the halls. Some of the animations were really bad and the last boss fight really took the feeling of the game and flipped turned it upside down. 

Overall, at its core, Kraken Manor is a cheap Amnesia clone with Slender stapled to its arse end. I would suggest giving this a shot if you wanted a short adventure game, not a scary spooky horror game. In the sea of cheap scary games, this could have differentiated itself if only it was a puzzle adventure game.  

Remember Dear Readers, You heard it here first. Off the Record, On the QT, and very Hush-Hush.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970314107', 'num_games_owned': 2304, 'num_reviews': 917, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1443682118}
review:
Amnesia certainly inspired a slew of imitators over the years, but few came out as polished as Kraven Manor. Originally a Guildhall student project, this one is a first-person romp through a spooky mansion with a creaky inhabitant and a cool gimmick for navigation. Once you start to dig into it, however, the polish starts to come off in some unfortunate ways. Part of that is in how the monster works, so if you're wary of spoilers you might want to skip this review.

The first thing you come across in the main hall of the manor is an incomplete model of the building. Throughout the game you find pieces of the model that you can fit as you please, freely rearranging the structure on the fly. It's a cool, simple gimmick that is used to unlock the final sequence... and that's it. You're not going to be doing much else in the manor, either. There's no inventory to fiddle with, only some books to get snippets from, items to lift and throw, and buttons to push.

What you are going to be doing is staring down the house's obnoxious bronze inhabitant. The enemy in Kraven Manor is one of those ever-popular Weeping Angel or SCP-173 types that only moves when you're not looking at it. I know that sounds kinda cool, but what that actually means is the moment you turn to work on a puzzle or leave the room, it caves your skull in. Sequences with the monster turn into aggravating games of Red Light, Red Light where you stare at it while trying to blind navigate to whatever the hell it was you were doing. And the thing goes all herky-jerky crazy when it's just out of your sight, resorting to straight-up teleporting if you're too good at keeping eye contact.

Easily the biggest knock against the game is its length. I beat it on Normal in just a little over 30 minutes. There's a Nightmare mode for masochists, because all it does is limit your flashlight and make the enemies kill you faster. If you're a jumpy type like me you'll get a few good rushes out of the enemy encounters and a few of the scripted moments, but it doesn't last. As a student project, Kraven Manor is undeniably impressive, but a paid product needs a lot more than what's offered here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198196444306', 'num_games_owned': 1155, 'num_reviews': 438, 'playtime_forever': 83, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1444068134}
review: The enemies behave like the weeping angels in the "Blink" episode of Doctor Who. They don't move while you're watching them. However, the manor is dark so you rely on your flashlight, which often fails in tense moments. Very atmospheric and clever horror game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093220384', 'num_games_owned': 1651, 'num_reviews': 148, 'playtime_forever': 247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 247, 'last_played': 1443536650}
review:
Kraven Manor was developed by a team of thirteen gradate students within a six month time frame. In some ways that fact is all too apparent, in other ways it's surprising just how much was accomplished with so little.

A first-person horror set within the eponymous building, the game's unique hook is that the structure of the whole manor can be changed dynamically. This is achieved by finding scale models of the individual rooms and setting them onto a board in the main hall, the arrangement of which determines what can be accessed. It's a really clever idea that lends itself well to an exciting scope of gameplay possibilities... or at least it could, it never really gets used to its full potential here. I think there were literally about two or maybe three instances in the whole game where the positioning of the rooms actually mattered in any significant way. Otherwise, the only thing it affected was the walking distance to the room you were heading to next.

I say "the whole game", there's isn't really all that much to it. There's maybe less than a dozen unique, relatively small areas to explore, all of which can be seen in probably about an hour for most players. But at least most of that time will be eventful as various set-pieces are triggered with regularity along the way, the vast majority of these being highly effective at unnerving the player. This is largely thanks to the main threat to your survival in the manor, a life-sized bronze mannequin that appears both lifeless and yet obsessive in its focus on your demise, made even more unsettling by its strange behaviour as it will only move and attack when not being looked at directly, otherwise perfectly playing its role of inanimate object.

So it has a solid idea at is core, a suitably terrifying creature stalking your progress and is well designed with its creepy locations and adequate visuals. But it's not without its issues. As I guess is to be expected given the nature of its birth, there are technical hiccups and bugs, several of which forced me to reload my game on more than a few occasions (sometimes not triggering an event necessary to progress, sometimes essential items couldn't be interacted with, and on a couple of instances closing the game and spitting me back out to Steam). Loading can also take a while, though in fairness, that's most likely due to the fact the rooms aren't in fixed locations, plus it only seems to load once at the start rather than room by room and is seamless thereafter. Movement also feels somewhat sluggish and cumbersome, though whether this is by design to add to the fear, or a result of poor programming is debatable.

Overall this ends up feeling like a very advanced prototype or proof of concept more than a fully-fledged game, and I really do hope it's developed further by the team into a greater experience. Despite its flaws, it really does have so much going for it well beyond a lot of other games in the genre made by more experienced people with more resources and hints at greater things to come for the young talents. So, if you're a fan of horror and have the patience and tolerance to see past its blemishes, then I think you'll be pleasantly surprised with Kraven Manor.

author: {'steamid': '76561198134420362', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 85, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1443172080}
review: A short horror game, but creepy and impressive. Recommend

author: {'steamid': '76561198013689732', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1442987295}
review:
As a project, it's okay.  As a game, it's simply lacking.
The bronze statue is a bare bones Slender Man stand-in (though it behaves just like the SCP statue) whom ceases to be threatening after the first few rooms and becomes laughable well before the end of the game.  The Unreal engine also causes objects to behave strangely, with wine bottles and glasses floating for no reason and being able to jump into/onto objects by holding something.  
It's a step above most attempts at horror on Steam, but frankly that's not saying much.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001427391', 'num_games_owned': 3386, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1442494390}
review: Un'avventura dalla brevissima durata che ci vedr√† muoverci in una villa che cambia l'ordine delle stanze, in modo tale da risolvere i facilissimi enigmi volti a giungere alla fuga di questa abitazione infestata da fantasmi e da manichini che, quando non illuminati dalla nostra fidata torcia, si muoveranno alle nostre spalle con l'intento di ucciderci (il protagonista sar√† inerme). Se l'avventura fosse stata pi√π lunga avrebbe sicuramente meritato di pi√π, ma a conti fatti √® da prendere esclusivamente in qualche bundle o a pochissimo prezzo.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965383380', 'num_games_owned': 239, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1441468182}
review: It's like Amnesia, at first I thought they used the same engine and it's even made with the Amensia's level editor, but actually not, Amnesia uses HPL Engine 2 and Kraven Manor uses Unreal. The story is interesting, but it ends too quickly (around 2h), with this kind of story you could get a nice long game. The graphic style is beautiful and music fits to the atmosphere, especially I liked the last song after you enter to the lift. It's more like a tech demo than a game. I got this game from a bundle so every cent was worth it, I would even consider to buy it with 5 euros if I didn't already have it. But for 10e it's too short.

author: {'steamid': '76561198100994803', 'num_games_owned': 2325, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 642, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 424, 'last_played': 1508127037}
review:
Very short, but worth the money. Especially worth it if you catch it on sale or in a bundle (I got my copy in a bundle).

Basically, you explore the manor, solving fairly simple puzzles to advance to the next areas. The puzzles arent overly complicated, or much more than "find object A, carry to point B, advance to area C".

The sound sets a pretty foreboding atmosphere, but the lightning seems especially loud compared to other sounds. The lighting effects are also pretty nice, and the graphics are also pretty well done.

Controls are pretty basic. F for flashlight, E to use things, WASD to move, LShift to sprint. Theyre also customizable.

The main enemy of the game is a bronze statue that will show up every now and then or attack you. Something I thought was kind of cool, that you may miss, is when at the very start of the game, walk up the bronze guy and hit E. As you walk away (back pedal), after a lightning crack, he turns to face where you were. Was a nice creepy touch by the devs.

Either way, the game is short but well-done, and fairly creepy (it reminded me of Rose Red, the Stephen King miniseries). Its well worth the buy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005566986', 'num_games_owned': 1394, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1435569314}
review:
un √©ni√®me jeu d'aventure / horreur en vue subjective.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078267201', 'num_games_owned': 362, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 204, 'last_played': 1435507028}
review:
You find yourself in Kraven Manor, a spooky and unsettling home to God only knows what. You don't particularly know the ins and outs of why you're there, nor do you know too much about the manor itself but you must press on in search of answers. There isn't much in the way of story or narrative here, the crumbs of story which you are fed are genrally found through interacting with old photographs and books that are strewn throughout each of the manor's creepy, harrowing halls and rooms. The gameplay is similar to other games of its kind; You are equipped with nothing but a flashlight and a journal which updates every so often after certain events occure. There are no weapons to speak of, running and keeping your wits about you are the only tools you'll need to survive. Exploration is the meat and bones of the game, whether you're looking for a key to open a locked door or a gear to fix a mechanism, you'll always be roaming room to room. 

Soon enough you'll come across the game's antagonist, a bronze statue that will terrorize you throughout certain sections of your journey through Kraven Manor. Keep your eyes on him and he's nothing more than any other creepy part of the manor's decor, but turn your back on him and you'll be terrofied by the loud, clanky footsteps that make their way toward you in the dark. It's a foe that will keep you on your toes throughout. One moment you'll be at ease and exploring, then the next you'll be fleeing in absolute horror as this metal abomination pursues you down darkened hallways. 

Arguably the biggest star of Kraven Manor is the manor itself. Dripping in atmosphere with rain splattering against the windows and thunder pounding through the halls, Kraven Manor seldom gives you any peace or moments rest. There were often times that I neglected some books and photographs, instead opting to get the hell out of whatever room I was occupying. 

Kraven Manor is  a short game, you'll probably finish up in an hour or maybe an hour and thirty depending on how thorougly you explore. 

If you're looking for a short, tense game to play one evening then it's a game you should definitely try. It may not do anything new and it never really strays away from established and tried mechanics, but Kraven Manor's bronze antagonist and gloomy setting are easily worth the price of admission.

author: {'steamid': '76561198158302387', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 174, 'last_played': 1437463893}
review: con una grafica a dir poco eccezionale e una ambientazione a dir poco terrificante kraven manor vi trasportera all interno di una villa non molto accogliente con all interno un manichino di bronzo che quando non guarderete vi ferira fino a uccidervi. enigmi non molto difficili accompagnati da un atmosfera di costante terrore rendono questo titolo spaventoso dall inizio alla fine con un finale inaspettato a mio parere.. tutto cio rendono questi 6 euro ben spesi

author: {'steamid': '76561198128998833', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 270, 'last_played': 1432853475}
review:
Kraven Manor is a title that I have to say I won't forget. It isn't by far the best game nor the worst but it is one of those games that has a little soul to it. The environment and sound are great, they will keep you on edge until you finish it. The story is very unique  and one of a kind if you ask me. I enjoyed it from start to finish and the secret ending gave me reason to make a second runthrough. It's a hidden gem that I was glad to have found and I'd recommend it for anyone who likes the creep-effect if you will. I suggest playing it on a rainy dim day, it happened that it worked out this way for me and it seemed to amp up the tension. The developer's are inspiring and are seemingly quick to give feedback. These are the kind of devs that deserve support. They earned mine and I think you'll agree if you visit the Manor. 

Final Verdict-7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198037929767', 'num_games_owned': 410, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1431858126}
review:
If you like horror games, I recommend. 
I do not like horror games and I am completely a wuss when it comes to this sort of game.
That said, the atmosphere was SO GOOD that I couldn't play more than a few minutes. 
I got the first room, plopped it down, and couldn't figure out how to get into it by the time the tension had mounted too high for me to be able to keep playing.
SUCH atmosphere. SO scary. Wow.

I have no idea how this game has such low ratings unless these people just don't like being scared because this game is SO scary! And a cool idea! I wish I had the guts to play it. *shudder*

author: {'steamid': '76561198071381962', 'num_games_owned': 3847, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 86, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1429901947}
review:
I would recommend it even though I didn't like it that much because I can see other players would. 

pros:
- Great atmosphere can be very tense. 
- Enemy encounters are nicely done. The creature itself can be very creepy.
- good music matches with the settings. 
- never came across any bugs. 

cons:
- Because the way the enemy is set up it's easy to avoid death. If you get hit once you can just wait it out while you recharge your health. This however brings the whole game to a standstill and pulls you out from the game.

La historia del juego solo se entiende si lees los documentos que te vas encontrando y vas encajando las piezas por tu cuenta. No hay duda de que este juego podr√≠a haber llegado a ser algo realmente grande y magn√≠fico, pero acab√≥ siendo algo realmente cortito.

Los puntos negativos que le pongo al juego es que exige DEMASIADOS recursos del propio ordenador solo para lo que es en total el propio juego. Si tu ordenador no tiene gran potencia y velocidad, tarda m√°s de uno o dos minutos en cargar la partida cuando sales del juego o te matan y necesitas cargarlo de nuevo ya sea desde el punto de control o desde el principio.

¬øMi recomendaci√≥n? No lo compres, a menos que tengas un buen ordenador. Porque si no... puede resultarte muy frustrante jugarlo. Especialmente si eres de los que lo quieren todo al momento en un juego y/o si eres de los que no tienen ninguna tolerancia a la paciencia.

review: I didn't enjoy this game but to be fair that's mainly because I don't like horror games :-) However one thing it gets right it the atmosphere. It's certainly very creepy and many moments made me jump. But there were annoyances too. The puzzles were not that difficult but they didn't really make sense, and neither did the story or the ending. Also the checkpoint saving tended to lock the game for a few seconds which broke the immersion. All in all I found it disappointing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075430580', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1425906900}
review:
This game is a bullcrap, one of the stinkiest ones but with a bunch of good ideas.
The devs needs to learn how to make games that people enjoy and not that cause frustration.
Puzzles are way too easy, sounds are clunky (jeez, those bottle sounds) and the end (I think I was close to it but I gave it up): You are being chased by a mannekin-like monster when suddenly lights out, you are literally in the middle of nowhere, and don't see anything. But when I say anything, I mean ANYTHING AT ALL. You, in the dark without being able to use lintern for some reason. Don't even see if I am running or I am stuck facing a wall. Turn around and the same dark everywhere. Then I am caught and dead.
Are you serious? Is that what you mean or I am doing something wrong?
Devs think running/being stuck in the dark is a fun?
OK, just to say a positive part, I liked the idea mannekins attack you only if they are out of sight.
UPDATE:  I watched several walkthrus and this must be a bug in my case because I found no others with same issue. But yet, this game still appears to be an extremely flawed one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198169968582', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1423187582}
review:
6/10 - Good Game

Kraven manor is your typical first person psychological horror experience, it follows the same formula of most indie horror games, which include solving puzzles, out running a monster or 2, and blah blah. Its a relatively short game that can be beaten in an hour or 2. At its price of 6 dollars I'd say it just about makes the cut for being worth it's asking price. It's borderline mediocre, but it so happens to be just be above average to warrant a rating of "good". I also managed to get a few scares out of it, which i was pleased with. The monster you encounter is pretty creepy, so thats a plus too. There were 2 particular sections in the game i found to be impressive. 

If your a horror fiend like me and lookin to spend a few bones for a an hour or 2 of entertainment, you'll find it here if your expectations aren't too high

author: {'steamid': '76561198040987377', 'num_games_owned': 3212, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1423186739}
review:
[h1]Overview[/h1]
Kraven Manor is extremely short, and beatable in under one hour. The puzzles are easy, with the enemy evoking a good sense of fear, and there is a slight alternate ending that nets a few extra achievements. It‚Äôs horror in the atmospheric, psychological kind, but it‚Äôs not the ‚Äúterror experience‚Äù that some people have claimed it to be.

[h1]TL:DR[/h1]
At its current price ($5.99 as of this review), it‚Äôs worth the purchase. I picked it up in a bundle myself many months back. At its full price, which I believe was $10 or just above, it would not be worth it, the value for your investment just wouldn‚Äôt be there.

[h1]The Good[/h1]
+ Graphics. For a bunch of university students, it looks good for the amount of time they‚Äôve put into it. Being university students, you wouldn‚Äôt think they‚Äôd have a lot of free time for this. But, the game looks fantastic. The mansion is nicely dark and dank, and the animations and lighting are terrific.

+ Sound. The sound and music work wonderfully, from letting you know if the enemy is nearby to the feeling of something bad is about to happen when the music crescendos.

+ Atmosphere. It‚Äôs not a jump scare game, and that‚Äôs a good thing. Not knowing where the enemy is while you‚Äôre running around a darkened room looking for something, it evokes a sense of fear while not relying on crap jumping out of doors to frighten you.

[h1]The Bad[/h1]
- Length. This is extremely short. It‚Äôs almost more of a tech demo than an actual game, and you‚Äôll be done in an hour, if that.

- Puzzles. They‚Äôre extremely easy. You will not need a walkthrough, or hints, or help of any kind.

- No replayability. For such a short game, that‚Äôs probably expected. There‚Äôs an alternate ending that really isn‚Äôt that good, that you can get by collecting three items during the normal play. There‚Äôs also a ‚ÄòNightmare‚Äô mode, which is slightly more difficult, but aside from an achievement for completing the harder mode, it‚Äôs all pretty much the same.

- Save stutter. For some reason, whenever the game autosaved, the game froze for a second or so. Which is odd. I‚Äôve never had that happen in any games made in UE.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002686126', 'num_games_owned': 2426, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1423146443}
review:
Ich habe lange √ºberlegt ob ich das Spiel empfehle. 
Im Endeffekt vor allem weil das Preis Leistungs-Verh√§ltnis an der Grenze liegt. 

Schlussendlich muss ich sagen es ist ein Sch√∂nes spiel was ich empfehle, aber besser im Angebot. 

Das Spiel hat mankos und welche die erkl√§r ich euch:

Das Hauptproblem: Die Spielzeit. Ich habe es jetzt in etwas √ºber 1.5h durch, hab mir dabei zeit gelassen, bin auch einmal gestorben, denke mann kann es wenn man die Storyelemente ignoriert in unter einer Stunde durchspielen. Es hat leider auch nur einen Wiederspielwert wenn man das geheimlevel finden will sonst eher weniger. 

Die Story, ist kaum vorhanden. Du bekommst hier und da einen Hinweis √ºber die b√∂sen Taten des Herrn Kraven aber im Endeffekt ist der volle Storyinhalt des Spiels in einem Raum anderer Spiele vorhanden. man bekommt pro raum 2 bis 6 Zeilen infos √ºber dies und das aber so richtig tief geht da ncihts und da wo du denkst es geht grad los, da endet der Spa√ü. 

Die Raumpositionierungsengin ist cool und echt hilfreich, geht aber zum Teufel. Wenn man mehr R√§ume h√§tte, noch mehr multiple Eing√§nge, komplexe ideen, dann k√∂nnte man richtig viel daraus machen, aber so wie das hier ist, ist es nur ein gimik welches zu schade zum programmieren ist so wie es hier zum tragen kommt.

Allerdings ein paar gute Worte zu dem Spiel:
Die Grafik ist wirklich gut und die Detailtreue die hier an den Tag gelegt wurde, findet man teils nicht einmal in AAA-titeln. Es sieht sich sch√∂n an und zusammen mit dem guten Sounddesign schafft es eine gute allgemeine Atmosph√§re. 

Das Monsterdesign ist klasse. Du hast ab und zu unbeabsichtigte Jumpscares, die man nachvollziehen kann, man kann den gegner in Schach halten und muss nicht wie in anderen Spielen sinnlos in kauf nehmen dass der einen t√∂tet oder der Spielcharakter einem den nerv raubt mit seinem Z√§hneknirschen. (Prinzipiell gefil mir die Idee mit der Taschenlampe schon bei Alone in the Dark) 

Alles in allem eigentlich ein sch√∂nes spiel dessen Inhalte aber auf die L√§nge vor die Hunde gehen.

review: I got this game as part of a bundle so I'm probably influenced by the very cheap price I got it for. Nontheless this is a pretty decent game. It's not super scary but enough so to still be intense. Most people complain about its short length but I think it's just fine for what it is is. It doesn't overstay its welcome. The graphics are beautiful and the overal design is cool. Would probably not buy it for more than a dollar or so but if you can get it cheap it's a pretty good game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028606026', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1421308336}
review:
Pros: Very creepy, unique exploration mechanics, great sense of immersion.

Cons: Super short, one bugged achievement.

I can't say I'd pay $10 for this game but if you love horror and it's on sale for $5 or less, definitely pick it up. You won't get more than 2 hours out of it but they are enjoyable hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993681861', 'num_games_owned': 2141, 'num_reviews': 181, 'playtime_forever': 167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 167, 'last_played': 1420132726}
review:
This is an indie gem and please do not get repulsed by a mixed vox populi. 

Firstly, this game is super short. I have finished my first playthrough in about 1.5 h taking my time to read all notes and paying attention to details. My second playthrough in which I aimed to get to the alternative ending took me about.. 27 minutes... the plot is simple but engaging, there are scary moments, but enough to remain scary, not frustratingly repetitive. The atmosphere of the old manor is felt and the graphics are surprisingly good conidering this is an indie title made by students (as far as I know). 

However what makes this game unique is the concept of dynamically creating the environment around you, which certainly should be developed into future, more complex project. 

Consider this game as an indie with a lot of potential to become a successful aaa if developed with proper amount of money and resources. 

This game if deffo worth getting on sale r in the bundle. You will not be disappointed. 

Also, I would recommend to all Cube (the movie) fans.. for a valid reason :)

7/10 = a solid short indie title, with nice concept and neat graphics

author: {'steamid': '76561198031651888', 'num_games_owned': 801, 'num_reviews': 441, 'playtime_forever': 128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1419685051}
review:
Il pleut des cordes et vous trouvez refuge dans un lugubre manoir. Vous n'en saurez pas plus sur le pourquoi du comment. A vous d'explorer le terrifiant manoir de Kraven. Portes qui se ferment toutes seules, tremblements, fant√¥mes, mannequins qui vous veulent du mal : ce jeu fait PEUR ! (ok, je suis une petite nature). C'est une exploration qui doit valoir son pesant de pilules antistress avec l'Oculus Rift (j'ai h√¢te d'avoir ce bidule).

Ce jeu a √©t√© cr√©√© par des √©tudiants pour un projet scolaire, ce qui est impressionnant vu la qualit√© technique. Les graphismes et effets sonores contribuent fortement √† l'atmosph√®re angoissante de ce jeu. J'ai r√©ellement pris peur par moments 

A part √ßa, le jeu est tr√®s lin√©aire, court et facile. En fait, il n'y a aucun r√©el puzzle. On n'est pas dans "the 7h Guest".
Certains aspects sont m√™me rat√©s, comme les objets qui semblent tous √™tre en caoutchouc (quand on lance une bouteille, elle va rebondir mollement).
L'id√©e de pouvoir constituer soi m√™me l'emplacement des pi√®ces du manoir est sympathique.

Mais, √ßa manque tout de m√™me de challenge. Je ne l'aurais pas achet√© si je ne l'avais pas eu dans un Bundle.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022820771', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 155, 'playtime_forever': 83, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1419385784}
review:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RvaVsU-mt5A

	Kraven Manor is a horror/ adventure game with a few puzzles thrown in.  
The story is sparse, and the graphics are passable.  The music does a good job 
of conveying an atmosphere of horror.  

	Your goal in the game is to escape the manor alive.  To make up for a 
sparing plot with little backstory, the game excells in its level design.  You will
feel spooked by the creepy atmosphere; it lures you into wanting to survive, to 
escape in one piece.  

	The game isn't all that long, but worth a few bucks.  The sense of immersion
alone makes it worth it.  

This is a summary of my review video, which I encourage you to watch if you are looking for a more in-depth review.

Thanks for your viewership and support; for more videos click here:
http:/www.youtube.com/user/SocioPyscho

author: {'steamid': '76561198068329619', 'num_games_owned': 717, 'num_reviews': 357, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1422580763}
review:
Kraven Manor.

The best way to describe this game is: "It looks good on paper, but in execution it missed"

This is a pyschological horror game. You will feel, the same feels that you felt from other games just like this one. It's puzzles are easy and the game isn't really that long. The atomsphere while creepy, and haunting it really just isn't enough from every now and then they will give that "jump scare" moment in the game but of course it's the standard horror movie: stuff falls, power goes out, your in a "Hell" situation, is something behind me? dark, creepy sections of the game. The usual

The developers really had something going here. But they missed their mark. If you want to try games like this. Best you avoid this one

author: {'steamid': '76561198026917831', 'num_games_owned': 326, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1419281867}
review: A puzzle game worth the horror it puts you through, I never thought I would be shaky around a drawing dummy but seriously, I can't play this without cheerful music or at night.  Great game with great machanics.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020833183', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1418946069}
review:
If you're looking for a challenging game, this is not it. Encounters are very tense but quickly becomes easy to handle. It's worth a try if you enjoy making others play the game and watch their reactions but other than that, there's not much to go back to after finishing the game.

Overall good game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001527683', 'num_games_owned': 668, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 145, 'last_played': 1419103416}
review:
Juego original, con mecanicas interesantes y buenas ideas, un maniqu√≠ muy inquietante y unos niveles bien dise√±ados. Puzzles sencillos y es ir avanzando y buscando ciertos objetos. Interesante y vale la pena peeeeero es MUY corto. En mis 2 horas y media de juego me lo he pasado dos veces (para ver el final secreto m√°s que nada) . Recomendado jugarlo en la dificultad m√°xima ya que en la normal pierde mucha tensi√≥n ya que la linterna es infinita.

Es una pena que sea tan corto porque tiene muy buenos conceptos que podr√≠an haberse explotado much√≠simo m√°s para hacer un gran juego y trama, la cual deja con ganas de saber m√°s cosas ya que no se d√° demasiada informaci√≥n y es m√°s trabajo de como lo interpretes tu. El tema de ir consiguiendo las habitaciones podr√≠a haberse alargado muchisimo y acerse muy interesante. 

Lo recomiendo si lo pillais bien baratito de oferta (yo lo consegu√≠ de gratis con las subastas xD) porque es buen juego y con buenas ideas pero extremadamente corto.  Si buscais un juego largo, con trama compleja y con mucha interacci√≥n, este no es el juego adecuado. Si buscais algo m√°s directo, sencillo pero entretenido y bastante tenso, este juego os gustar√° pero os dejar√° con ganas de m√°s.

review:
I've played through most of the game so far. I'm currently at the final boss. I must say, I love the idea of building a model of the house in order to reach more locations! For the time played, the game was very enjoyable. 

I do wish it were longer though and hopefuly we'll see something similar to this on a much bigger scale in the future! A lot can be done with building the world around you in a horror game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062269122', 'num_games_owned': 1154, 'num_reviews': 290, 'playtime_forever': 419, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 419, 'last_played': 1417849395}
review:
Le doy a "Kraven Manor" la medalla de plata por ser el segundo juego que m√°s veces me ha hecho reiniar el ordenador. Al margen de esto, ¬øde qu√© va "Kraven Manor"? Pues ni idea, pero supongo que lo t√≠pico. Entras porque s√≠ en una mansi√≥n misteriosa y te pones a corretear por ella. El dise√±o de la mansi√≥n me gusta, aunque es peque√±a, y eso hace que el juego sea corto. Para empezar, cuando comenzamos la partida, casi no podemos movernos por la mansi√≥n hasta que encontramos una maqueta de una zona de la mansi√≥n, la cual tendremos que llevar a una gran mesa en el vest√≠bulo de la misma y acoplarla puerta con puerta a una maqueta del vest√≠bulo. En ese momento escuchas un ruido y la puerta donde hayas encajado la maqueta se desbloquear√°. Entonces te das cuenta que las puertas de la mansi√≥n se van abriendo y cerrando seg√∫n encajes las maquetas que vas encontrando en tu deambular por el juego. Para que te hagas una idea, las habitaciones son como un cubo de Rubik y se reordenan conforme lo hagas t√∫ con las maquetas. A m√≠ me gust√≥ esta mec√°nica, pero yo es que soy muy facil√≥n.
Explorando por ah√≠ no lucharemos con nadie. Lo m√°s parecido ser√° escapar dos o tres veces de unos maniqu√≠s de bronce que nos persiguen y no dan miedo ninguno, as√≠ que entre que el juego es corto, la mansi√≥n peque√±a y que casi todo el juego es un paseo, "Kraven Manor" se queda en una an√©cdota, y es una pena, porque me esperaba m√°s de un juego que ten√≠a pinta de ir al grano: mansi√≥n chunga, linterna y ponte a explorar.
En la parte t√©cnica, el juego necesita demasiados recursos para lo que es, y mi ordenador sudaba la gota gorda para moverlo. Dos cuelgues m√°s y me hubiera terminado Don Quijote de la Mancha.
Para los que s√≥lo se leen la √∫ltima frase: no pagues m√°s de 1 euro por √©l. Idea buena, pero desarrollo flojo.

[b]Entonces, ¬øde qu√© va el juego?[/b] De explorar. Lograr abrir puertas cerradas y todo ese rollo.
[b]Con estos juegos me agobio. ¬øEs complicado?[/b] No. Es bastante f√°cil.
[b]¬øQu√© juego tiene la medalla de oro?[/b] El "STALKER: Shadow of Chernobyl". Me pet√≥ hasta la tarjeta gr√°fica.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078093594', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 348, 'last_played': 1417645773}
review:
Kraven Manor no es el mejor juego de terror jam√°s visto, pero es un juego de terror muy decente. Del estilo de Penumbra o Amnesia pero con menos interacci√≥n todav√≠a, el juego tampoco necesita que el personaje se esconda por tanto no tiene opci√≥n de agacharse (¬øextra√±o? Puede ser, pero cuando juegues es mejor permanecer al descubierto y alumbrar bien con la linterna, ya descubrir√°s por qu√©). La interacci√≥n con objetos tambi√©n es escasa, pero deja lo justo para avanzar en la historia y creeme, nada m√°s empezar puede ser que digas..."pues vaya". Pero no te da tiempo lamentar nada, adem√°s el hecho de no utilizar casi nada aumenta la tensi√≥n. La historia a simple vista es muy sencilla, te vas enterando de lo sucedido (sacando tus propias conclusiones) por fotografias, recortes de periodicos o libros con muy pocas palabras, una peque√±a frase en cada una.

Kraven Manor, gana realmente en el apartado sonoro y visual, visualmente se ve muy bien, tiene gran detalle y los efectos sonoros son muy intensos, te sacar√°n varios saltos de la silla, si est√°s con los cascos y a oscuras. Los enemigos del juego, para mi han sido todo un acierto, personalmente lo he visto casi todo, pero cada vez que veo este "tipo" de enemigo, dentro de mi se retuerce algo extra√±o que me inquieta y eso hizo que disfrutara mucho del juego, hubo momentos que dud√© en seguir (pero esto es personal, porque como he dicho, me da mucha cosilla ese tipo de enemigo).

El juego dura tan solo entre 1 hora y media a 2 horas y poco. Tiene posibilidad de rejugarlo para conseguir ciertos objetos, que en mi primera pasada, no tengo ni idea de donde podr√≠an estar. 
Kraven Manor te mantiene en tensi√≥n practicamente al empezar, pero a partir del Climax final esa emoci√≥n baja un poco (puede ser por el cambio de sonido que no le pega mucho o porque a lo mejor me esperaba algo m√°s). En f√≠n, la idea principal me ha gustado bastante, ¬øa lo mejor con un poco m√°s de argumento y duraci√≥n, habr√≠a cambiado la cosa a mejor? ¬øo a peor?... no se, personalmente me lo he pasado muy bien lo poco que ha durado, al final un poco frio, con ganas de m√°s, pero bien. 

Para mi, el puntazo, los malditos enemigos con sus siniestro sonidos y posturas. Lo peor, no aprovechar la mansi√≥n lo suficiente, esto habr√≠a dado mucho juego.

Si est√° en oferta es una compra recomendable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017381248', 'num_games_owned': 1611, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1412264656}
review:
Its got all the elements of a modern horro game except one. It has events outside your control, jumpscares, things changing position when you turn away, mandatory puzzle-solving, and a lovable creepy assailant. What it lacks is length, its easily less than 2 hours if there aren't any show-stopping bugs (only saw one - a medallion thar didn't slot into place) for normal, no clue about the tougher difficulty.

If I recall there are two configurable difficulty levels, and I assume the tougher one allows for access to slightly more content, which may make more content accessible with the added challenge (which would make sense because there were some moving parts I couldn't complete on normal).

The one knock I have with the gameplay content is the chase sequence towards the end. Repetitiously running through an I'm-being-chased maze til completing it isn't spooky or scary, its kinda lame and boring. Okay maybe two knocks - ZERO explanation as to why the character ended up in there, who they are, or anything else, so I really have zero connection to the avatar I'm controlling and feel no empathy for it. Other than that, there wasn't much in the way of psychological horror, mostly jumpscares. I have a natural +10 resistance with saving throws against jumpscares, I just laugh at them. :)

That being said, its great for a student project, and definitely has all the atmosphere and elements of a modern horror game. Thumbs up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084285016', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1414912326}
review: Great game! Scary but it ends quickly. If they were to add more for the price of the game it would be a great game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996678922', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1414880552}
review:
This is a really well done, VERY short game with relatively little replay value... it would be a rental if such things still existed. I would reccomend purchasing it on sale.

What it does, it does very well. The game is creepy, well orchestrated, has some neat lay-out mechanics, and gives a nice feeling of unease throughout the story... the problem is that there just isn't much story. There's no intro or reason why you're in the manor in the first place... no investigation is mentioned, and the clues to the tale are scattered minimally throughout the game.

The antagonist is effectively creepy until you figure out the mechanic behind the attacks and how to stay safe... and at that point, the game suddenly begins to feel like a rail haunted house ride. You're there to experience a mostly linear story, and you can do it in relative safety. It just doesn't feel like it at first.

If I knew there would be more game added on to what's already here, I'd recommend it at full price. As is, its just really far too short.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001502765', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1414228492}

This is a good game. Fairly predictable, yet surprising in it's own ways. I enjoyed it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043609914', 'num_games_owned': 3556, 'num_reviews': 834, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1413473203}
review: Kraven Manor is the full game based on the demo that was available for free for some time now. But now that the full game has come to steam will you want to play it ? In Kraven Manor you play as a unknow guy who enters Kraven Manor. Once you get there you start to find out deep and twisted stuff about the manor. Which i will not spoil here because its more spoiler territory. Overall how is Kravens Manor ? Its not good in any way. Right off the bat i have to say something about the demo too. The game barely added anything that wasnt in the demo. Only a few improvements and a new level. The game is still incredibly short just barely an hour long. The game does look great for an indie and the enviroment is outstanding so  is the atmosphere. But where does the game go wrong ? Well everywhere else. The game has incredibly stupid puzzles and not to mention dealing with the monster is also stupid. It does play like a fast paced amnesia but thats about it, Pros: The game looks great and plays great too. Oustanding atmosphere. Cons:  Stupid puzzles, Annoying enemies, incredibly short and anti climatic ending, Overall get Kraven Manor only when its on sale otherwise just skip this. I give Kraven Manor a 5.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197970842475', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1412577875}
review: Let me start by saying this is a good game. Better than a vast majority of the indie crap that's out there. The graphics are great, the game mechanics are sound,  it's a game that had an obvious amount of love invested in it. The reason I don't recommend this game is that it is terribly short experience with a threadbare story and few real action pieces. The game isn't an experience in terror, like some would claim, but felt more like a teaser to a much bigger game. I'd say this was more a $5 game than $10. Even so, if you've got money to burn and an hour to kill, go ahead and give it a go.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013536450', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1413503470}

author: {'steamid': '76561197995044455', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1412257873}
review: S'il y a une chose sur laquelle les joueurs seront d'accord, c'est que Kraven Manor aurait gagn√© √† √™tre plus long. Cela trahit donc qu'il est loin d'√™tre mauvais. Et pour cause, c'est un petit jeu d'horreur tr√®s plaisant. Graphiquement, il est selon moi, tr√®s beau, l'ambiance sonore est tr√®s agr√©able (hormis quelques d√©tails qui sonnent parfois √©trangement), et l'atmosph√®re du jeu reste angoissante. Angoissante cependant, pas terrifiante car le jeu est trop court pour que l'on s'en impr√®gne r√©ellement. L'id√©e de la maquette du manoir est √©galement innovante et int√©ressante (bien que pas totalement exploit√©e √† mon go√ªt). L'histoire n'est pas mauvaise non plus (mais pas exceptionnelle, j'en conviens). Alors certes, il est peut √™tre un peu cher pour sa dur√©e de jeu (1h tout au plus) mais il ne faut pas oublier qu'il a √©t√© √† la base, cr√©√© par des √©tudiants. Et selon moi, ils m√©ritent bien une r√©mun√©ration pour cette exp√©rience!

author: {'steamid': '76561198001301431', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1412057180}
review:
Great horror game. If you expect a lot of jumpscares i am going to disappoint you. There are moments that Kraven Manor will scare you and make you cry but these are few throughout the whole game. What makes this game an absolute must have in your library is the dark and creepy atmosphere and the general feeling that there is someone, something behind you the whole time. A very beautiful game with gorgeous graphics that will make you forget it's an indie one.
The mechanic that allows you to interact with miniature rooms in order to gain entrance to the same rooms in the manor is innovative and brings a fresh breath to the genre.
Puzzles are not very hard to solve but neither too easy to think the game is failing. The only negative aspect of the game is the fact that is short. It will take you 50 mins - 1 hour max to finish. The great ending though will make you forget about that very fast. You should buy Kraven Manor if you are looking for a true horror experience.
